Reviews.Author: Lawrence P.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice how I love thee!!! We've been there multiple times.The first thing you notice about this place is how packed it gets.  There is literally nowhere to wait for your table. The bar gets jammed packed.  It's almost impossible to get a drink while there given the amount of people eating at the bar and/or waiting for a table and/or drink.  You will also wait for a table well beyond your reservation time. Some times weeeeeeell beyond!!!!So why the 5 stars?!?!?!  Because once you get through the fact that the parking lot is so tight it was made for people who drive yugo's (they do have valet thankfully!),  and once you get through waiting way past your reservation in a small tight area with nowhere to go, you will experience a meal to remember.I love this place's food!!! We had it all.  From the Bangkok Rolls to the Coconut Shrimp to the Chilean Sea Bass to the Lobster Pad Thai to the Ribeye to the Seafood Medley Soup to the Special Fried Rice to the White Chocolate Cheesecake to the Coconut Fried Ice Cream to the Chocolate Peanut Butter Mousse to the... you get the idea!!!!  And it was ALL so good!!!So be ready to be somewhat annoyed at first as this place is packed weekdays and weekends.  But get through it because once you are seated, it's on!!!!!!!  (PS: As if I needed a reason to go back, their corkage fee is only $15 so bring your wine and enjoy!!!)

Reviews.Author: Sean M.
Reviews.Content: "Way Overrated"This place was an unpleasant surprise.One day I noticed Danielle B and Limuel Yelp checked-in at Thai Spice. After reading the reviews, I was generally impressed, so I decided to try it out. Once entering Thai Spice, I  immediately realized the interior was unbecoming of the restaurants location, it was quite alluring. I was greeted by romantic mellow lighting and the pleasant sound of live piano music. There was also a couple of large salt water fish tanks filled with moving bright colors of life.But that is where the pleasantries ended...Perusing the menu I could not help but notice everything was grossly overpriced, even for this enticing place.I ended up ordering  the Lobster Pad Thai ($26) bit.ly/Opzyh9 and an order of Thai Spring rolls ($5.50) bit.ly/1gBHx1r .The Lobster pad thai was served with a very small lobster tail, a scant amount of noodles and very little vegetables. The Thai spicyness was missing, the dish was blandish and the noodles were oily. STAR RATING 3.0The Thai Spring rolls were average at best, there was nothing impressive about the appearance, taste nor texture. STAR RATING 3.0The service was decent, but nothing to be dancing about. STAR RATING 3.5The live entertainment was impressive. I was familiar with the young lady singing & playing the piano from a previous Yelp Elite event. She is angelic! STAR RATING 4.5-SUMMARYFood ~3 STARSAmbiance ~4 STARSPrices ~1 STAREntertainment ~4 STARSService ~3.5 STARSTo me the food is not worth any price, much less the price they are asking for. Basically you are paying for the entertainment and the ambiance, which is not enough, you need good cuisine to match.

Reviews.Author: Danielle B.
Reviews.Content: Apparently SoFlo Thai food and I are just not going to get along. Some things are just not meant to be, I suppose. Hate to go against the grain, but gotta share my experience.Now when you enter Thai Spice, it has a lot of promise. A dimly lit ambience that kinda makes you feel you're underground somewhere. There was live entertainment, a lovely lady on the piano. Incidentally, I have seen this pianist before so that was a pleasant surprise. As I take a look at the menu, I see all the familiar Thai dishes that I often crave. But then I get a not so pleasant surprise when I see that pad thai is $17, chicken curry is $17, any seafood dish is $20+...... what freaking alternate universe of fancy schmancy arm and a leg (and maybe even a kidney) pricing is this?! If they charge these prices, they must be serving the best damn Thai food EVER.Hate to spoil the ending, but it wasn't the best damn Thai food. It was pretty darn average. The pad see ew had nicely cooked noodles with a tasty sauce and veggies. Not a bad dish (still not worth the price). Our other entree was the samrod chicken which was forgettable. We also had the tom yum goong (seafood hot and sour soup). A few spoonfuls in, I find a hair. Not just a hair, but a questionably curly hair. Why oh why. I'll pass on paying high prices for being served hair in my food. Thanks, but no thanks.

Reviews.Author: Natalie L.
Reviews.Content: A friend brought us here for dinner. I'd never tried Thai food and wowwwwwwwwwwwww. AMAZING. Pricey, but so worth it. Great ambiance. Great service. I've tried thai food elsewhere, after going here, and nothing holds a candle to this place. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: TheGirlWho L.
Reviews.Content: Don't be surprised by the location and the appearance from the outside. When you walk inside Thai Spice, it's another story. I originally heard many great things about this restaurant and there was a deal on Living Social, so that's why I tried it out. I went on a Saturday night for dinner with my boyfriend. There was live music in the bar area and the restaurant was busy. We were greeted by a friendly waitress who was very helpful with suggesting items to order. We started with the sesame chicken wings. These were the best chicken wings I've ever had. The waitress mentioned her uncle came up with the recipe. I ordered the skirt steak that came with bok choy and jasmine rice. It was a house speciality, so you could either a soup or a salad. My boyfriend ordered the three buddies that came with jasmine rice. His order was also a house speciality. When my skirt steak came to the table, I was shocked to see how huge the portion was. The presentation was also really nice. Overall - the waitress was really great, the service was really on point, and the food was really delicious. This is going to be one of my regular restaurants I dine at. I was highly impressed and can't believe I waited this long to try it out.

Reviews.Author: Brandon S.
Reviews.Content: Omg the best thai food ive had!!! The green curry beef amazig! The skirt steak perfection! The drinks incredible! The only thing that was on the downside was the hostesses. They were super friendly but took awhile to acknowledge me and seemed a little overwhelmed. I will def make this regular restaurant to eat and drink at. Really Really enjoyed the music and atmosphere. Will be back soon

Reviews.Author: Renee R.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Thai Spice to celebrate my birthday last night.  This place is wonderful.  The entree was amazing and the deserts were delicious!  This is a great place for a romantic night.  I cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Author: Madhu K.
Reviews.Content: I visit Fort Lauderdale regularly for business and frequent local restaurants during my stay there. This is one of my favorite places to visit for my Thai fix. The place is located in a strip mall and there can be waiting during peak hours. I love the appetizers especially their steamed dumplings. Most of the items taste good and service is prompt and attentive.Looking forward to visit the place in my next trip!

Reviews.Author: Lisa B.
Reviews.Content: Compared to other Thai restaurants I've tried, this one tasted the least authentic. The nam sod had a strange taste and was full of long pieces of ginger root that were about 1 cm thick. While I do love ginger, it was way too much. Speaking of way too much, the prices of everything other than the Thai iced tea were WAY too much. Between my husband and me, we had three Thai teas, two appetizers, two entrees, and two desserts -- the same amount of items we typically order at our local favorite Thai place in Rochester -- and it cost twice as much as at our local place! (Specifically, it cost almost $100!) Two final downsides: FREEZING air blasted down on our booth during most of the dinner, and the noise level was DEAFENING mostly due to a large, boisterous group we were next to and enhanced by other nearby diners trying to compete.

Reviews.Author: Maryann C.
Reviews.Content: Wow! We know the food is good because we been there for dinner many times.  they've opened up the bar section and they have happy hour! And it Is extremely happy with half-price drinks and delicious appetizers. Call calamari is to die for spicy and sweet and tender. There's so many delicious appetizers on the menu can't remember them all now but you need to go there for happy hour Monday through Friday 5-7? They also have music on Friday and it was great...

Reviews.Author: Richard O.
Reviews.Content: I only went once, and a friend took me.  All I can say is he NEVER raves about  anyplace, lives very close to this restaurant, goes there all the time, and loves it.  He took me as a 'reward' for helping him with a huge house project.  I love Thai food; my brother's wife is from Singapore and her family owns restaurants there, so I feel like my trips to CA to eat Thai food under her direction were educational.  This place is OK, but overpriced.  The regular Pad Thai is better at Sushi Thai in Boca.  The Nam Sod is not good at all, and the other things I tasted were good but nothing special.  Others love this, so go and make up your own mind.  I assume, since my friend is a regular, that we got the best possible everything. I guess you should go and make up your own mind, but it is NOTHING like the Thai food in LA, I promise you, but they charge LA prices.  Like I wrote, go and make up your own mind.  Cheers!

Reviews.Author: Jan N.
Reviews.Content: Bed Thai restaurant I've been too.  I over stuffed myself on the crispy curry puffs, the green curry, and the lobster pad Thai.  I couldn't stop eating.  My wife also enjoyed immensely!

Reviews.Author: Chloe' M.
Reviews.Content: Best Thai food I've had. Service was very good and everyone was extremely nice! A little pricey though, but not too bad.

Reviews.Author: Rob G.
Reviews.Content: For those of you that know me, you know I dont give out 5 stars that often, however Thai Spice really does deserve it.  I have been coming here on and off for over 15 years.  I discovered this place  when working close by and almost wrote them off, however I am so glad I didnt.  This place has really transformed lately.  They have physically expanded the restaurant (again) and added a grill which allows them to increase their menu options.  Ive had some of the best meals of my life here and last night was no different.  We arrived around 10pm and the 2 of us were seated immediately.  It wasnt too busy, most likely due to our arrival time.  My wife started off with a glass of the house merlot, and I had "The King", which was a vodka martini with ginger and cucumber.  Im not usually into foofoo drinks, but I wanted something different.  It  was good and I enjoyed it.  We ordered the crispy calamari and two house salads.  We were taking our time, enjoying the time alone (with no kids), sipping our drinks. Calamari came out and was awesome.  Lightly breaded, crispy with a nice sweet chili sauce.  Shortly after our salads came out and the waiter was nice enough to bring us both the peanut and ginger dressing.  I didnt bother with the ginger because I love their peanut dressing.  Its not as thick as other thai places Ive been too, but it has really good flavor.  As I said we were taking out time, so the waiter kindly reminded us that the kitchen will be closing soon, so he wanted to make sure our orders got in.  We ordered shrimp pad thai and green curry w/ fried tofu.  I normally order the panaang or red, but i do like green too, which by default is much more spicier than the others.  We sat enjoying the scenery, there was a nice fish tank in front of us, so really we just enjoyed every non-rushed second.  We could hear the singing of a girl in the "Buddha Lounge" in the background which was nice.  The waiter was very attentive, he saw we needed refills.  I went with a Jack Daniels on the rocks, but when you know him as long as I do, you refer to him as John Daniels (thanks Al Pacino).  Wifey had another Merlot.  Shortly after our food came out.  Pad Thai was good.  Not dry at all, nice flavor, and the shrimp was cooked perfectly.  These were nice size shrimp, not the small ones for sure.  The green curry was also done just right.  Spicy but not too much, sauce was thick, tofu was crispy on the outside and soft and creamy on the inside.  I asked for a side of crushed peanuts and got a small bowl.  Definitely not skimpy.  I guess the benefits of eating slow and taking you time is you get full before you are done with your food and have plenty of awesome leftovers.  Yep, cant wait for it.  Overall experience was fantabulous.  Thai Spice never disappoints.  If you have never been here, you must try it.   They really take the time to make your dining experience one that you will remember.  Dinner can get pricey, so if you want to try them out and not spend a lot of money, they have great lunch specials with the same quality and great service/atmosphere.  A true gem in South Florida.  What are you waiting for?

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: I've been driving by this place at least 6 months and finally got a chance to try it out one night.  Very romantic place with dark lighting and ambiance.  The Service is top notch!  We never had half a glass because the staff was always there to fill it up.  As always at a Thai restaurant I get the Curry Seafood plate.  And I always ask for the hottest spice which will always be "Thai Spicy".  It was hot and it did make me sweat however the favoring didn't quite make it to my standards.

Reviews.Author: Maria G.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Thai Spice several times.   I have always been pleased with the food. Love the grilled calamari  & shrimp with vegetables. My friend ordered the Penang Curry and loved it. The yuca cake was very good. It is pricey but worth it. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Jennie J.
Reviews.Content: The reviews of Thai Spice did not lie, this place was great!  They have a small parking lot but also offer valet.  There's outside seating available but since it was raining we dined inside.  The fish tanks and various dining rooms create an intimate atmosphere which is great for a date!My date and I decided to try some of the fun martini's (my pick-lucky him ha ha) so I started us out with the Appletini- which was made with Fireball creating a Cinnamon Apple taste.  They were delicious, even for a guy who normally doesn't like fruity martini's he said it was "manly" enough for him with the Fireball Whisky.  I ordered the Pad Thai and my date had the Panang Chicken.  Both were absolutely delicious and very big portions!  I had looked on Yelp before coming (obviously) and saw that someone had posted a Lemon Drop Martini...it was not on the menu but I ordered it- thanks to my VIP Yelpers ;)  It was delicious...if you like the typical Lemon Drop Shot you will defintely love this martini!  It was very strong!Overall, great experience, great food and drinks!  Our waiter could have been a bit more attentive, I hate when I have to constantly ask for more water...that should be one of the easiest parts of your jobs but other than that it was great and I highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Sach M.
Reviews.Content: Great food and great service! The staff was so friendly and nice. Absolutely one of the best thai places to go to in the FLL area. Unfortunately, we went there on the last day of our trip but we would be back.

Reviews.Author: Night Ryder I.
Reviews.Content: Expensive but good food & large portions, very attentive wait staff. Absolutely loved the chicken rice soup. Tasty Crispy calamari appetizer. Cheesecake very good. Nice live music, intimate indoor & outdoor seating.  But why the bring the extra spoons with my dessert?? I didn't plan on sharing!! (jk, not really.)

Reviews.Author: narisa s.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful ambiance. Food portions were very generous.  Gets very dark at night difficult to see menu and each other. good dishes were.chicken with basil and beef with garlic

Reviews.Author: Gary M.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice is an amazing dining adventure.Everything I have ordered is fresh and delicious and the happy hour is a great deal. Shawn is a wonderful bartender and always serves with a smile. Thank you, Gary

Reviews.Author: Kristin C.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere is so romantic and perfect outside, and it's almost always a lovely day in balmy South Florida.  Also, the day we came the talented and beautiful Joanna of Sweden was playing to my delight.We had the seafood red curry since it wasn't a combination we were likely to see at other Thai restaurants.  I wouldn't say it was outstanding, but it was a good solid dish.Overall, I'd maybe come back.  It seems a little pricey, and the parking lot is a little too crazy for my tastes, but it is a nice classy restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Andrew L.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice has been our favorite special occasion restaurant for many years now.  There are many Thai places in Broward County, but Thai Spice is the most authentic and simply the best Thai food I have ever had, and that includes two visits to Thailand!  Last night my friend Ray and I enjoyed their two-for-one happy hour at the bar along with half priced appetizers which are offered from 5PM to 7, first come, first served.  Our lovely barkeep mixed me up two delicious Lemon Drop Martinis, while Ray enjoyed two Tsing Tha beers.  For our starters I had their crispy calamari, my favorite, and Ray had the sesame chicken wings.  Moving into the warm, inviting dining room, I enjoyed my usual shrimp and scallop medley, while Ray had their Dreaming Chicken.  Both of our dinners were outstanding, as usual, and we left fully satisfied by our tasty, fresh Thai dinners served in gracious style by our attending waitress.  If you want the best Thai food in the States, this is it!

Reviews.Author: Joe B.
Reviews.Content: Very good food the panag beef and chicken are great.  It is a little expensive for thai food and i would not go here without a promotion.  I like the feel of the restaurant and the nice decor.

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: Food is consistently good. Always get stuck next to fish tank with dead fish floating by. I think I will tell the manager this time.

Reviews.Author: Jason G.
Reviews.Content: After a few more trips to Thai Spice​ it was necessary for me to bump them up another star. As the the wise Nick A stated, happy hour is where its at. The calamari, straight out of R.I. like Lamar Odom, is the best Asian served calamari I've ever experienced. High quality, fresh and with just the right amount of sauce. It's impossible to order just one plate of this stuff.They've tweaked the restaurant a bit and installed a hipper sign out front, so it no longer looks like a rub & tug massage parlor. But speaking of that, once you're done with this TS (no Terror Squad), there are quite of few places a stones throw away if you truly need a happy ending.I know when I'm at Thai Spice, I don't have just a happy ending, I have a happy beginning too. All the entrees I've had from the lobster pad thai, shrimp panang or special fried rice is goes hard in the paint. Make sure you ask for the special hot sauce, I can't stress that enough, the sh*t is Paul Walker (fiyah).

Reviews.Author: Tracy A.
Reviews.Content: It's been some time since i have been back to Thai Spice. They have done a TON of renovations. I'm happy to see the decor match the quality of the food. I was craving curry and bamboo shoots but I was tempted by the variety on the menu. We started with the grille octopus. I wasn't impressed. It was a bit too chewy and flavorless. I have had this dish elsewhere and like it. I will try a different appetizer next time.My husband had the seafood red curry and loved it. Lots of big pieces of shrimp and scallops. He had it Thai spicy and it was. Oftentimes its not spicy enough for him.I had the chicken green curry. I loved it. I forgot how much I love green curry when it's done well. They do it very well here. It was creamy and delicious. Not runny and flavorless. It was even good the next day for lunch. I think I'll be back for lunch and dinner more often!

Reviews.Author: Sherry W.
Reviews.Content: This place is excellent for Thai curry. We ordered the green chicken curry and the red pork curry. Ordering it hot was too overbearing. Next time I will order medium. The veggies in the curry are fresh and crispy. The curries are served with unlimited white rice.The service was friendly and efficient. Waters were always refilled without asking.Ambiance is quiet and dark. Nice artwork on the walls. Great wine selection.

Reviews.Author: Greg O.
Reviews.Content: I ate lunch here yesterday with one of my neighbors here in Florida. I have not eaten here since they renovated their lovely restaurant. I enjoyed walking by the tall trees/plants buffering the parking lot and entrance to the inside.I lived in Bangkok for two years and have been seeking real Thai flavors ever since in NYC, California, and around the world. I also lived in Japan and cook lots of Asian food. I know real Asian food from Americanized style.For some reason US-based Thai restaurants and Asian restaurants in general, will typically water down their authentic flavors, spice and heat. Please teach American's that original and authentic flavors and spice is better than pu pu platters!I love NE Thai style food the best. I love the spicy and sour flavors. I had authentic Gai Yang (roast chicken) with the same brown sauce you get in Thailand. The charcoal flavor on the chicken was delicious. We also ordered a crispy squid dish that was tender and really tasty that we shared. We both loved this dish. I'd like to see more Thai dishes on the menu like: Fried Morning Glory, Moo Manaow, and Laarb Moo/Gai. They have Nam Sod but I like to see both on the menu.I recommend this restaurant and encourage the chef's to trust we will eat real Thai food from your kitchen. I did think the prices were high though.

Reviews.Author: RM K.
Reviews.Content: Pro: 1.Great thai/asian food!' I'm Asian and i know whats right and meh with Asian food ;-)2.Interior!!!Love the fish tank and some Thai traditional pictures on the wall!3.Great live music! The singer(some young lady with dark blonde hair?) voice is great all the time! 4.Small bathroom but super clean! I saw employees check every single hour to make sure clean! Con: Small Parking lot..         The price? Actually I cant complain about the price.... When you go to restaurant in Thai... Some of Asia countries ... Pad thai is $1.... But when you go to fancy restaurants in south beach, Miami... Same pad thai will cost you $25!! This restaurant food price is pretty fair to me ;-)

Reviews.Author: Aman P.
Reviews.Content: I'm so disappointed with the food & service. Never coming back here again. Twice the messed up on my order. I been here twice and both time nothing but disappointing

Reviews.Author: Rick V.
Reviews.Content: Went again on a Sat night. .busy/packed.service was good and the food is always great.Try fried calamari app. Always a winner. First time I had a  steak here..says prime steaks well we raise cattle and ours are "checked and marked prime from the processing" wanted bone in ribeye...sold out..well ordered porterhouse. ..sold out...they did have a ribeye. Steak was good. .not great. Stick with the calamari. ..Always a winner.

Reviews.Author: Johnny H.
Reviews.Content: Thanks Yelpers...   This place was a good as the reviews claim.       My wife and I went here for lunch.  We got a grilled squid appetizer, which was really great.   The squid was flawlessly grilled -- tender and not at all chewy.   The dipping sauces were tasty and mad the dish.  The portion size was surprisingly large.For our entrees, I got the panang curry with beef.    The sauce was perfectly rich and tasty.   My wife got Pad Thai, which was also fantastic.Here's what we really appreciated; we always order our Thai meals "Thai Hot."   Rarely do restaurants get it right.   It's either served way too mild or its so loaded with capsaicin that you can't taste anything else.    Thai Spice got it perfect -- enough to cause you to break a sweat without killing you.My only gripe is this meals are relatively expensive compared to other Broward Thai restaurants.   Our lunch was slightly over $50 with a single appetizer, two lunch-special entrees, and the tip -- that's with no drinks, just water.  Still, I'll definitely return.   Even with the price, it was worth it.

Reviews.Author: Amy G.
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find! I happily discovered this restaurant last year & I have been a frequent visitor since. An incredible aspect of this business is that not only is the food excellent, it's also consistent. Every time I have eaten here, it's always incredible. Even if I were to order the sane item more than once, it's consistently delicious. The service is good, the atmosphere is lovely. The only downside is sometimes there is a crowd waiting to be seated. But you certainly can't fault a restaurant for that, that just means that it's loved by many.

Reviews.Author: Nick A.
Reviews.Content: If ur not here @ 1700 ur not doing happy hour justicespicy calamar is the best app no iphone south of fl georgia line & is 1/2 off come 5pmbartender from hawaii slings martinis like a matt harvey slidervariety is the spice of life & T.S offers all types of flavors & spicesask for the hot sauce plate & tell then trevor sent youcassava cake is the happy ending

Reviews.Author: Kornika K.
Reviews.Content: Originally discovered this place back in 2008 (or maybe 2009) sometime and it had the most phenomenal Pad Siew ever. The other food was awesome as well and I'd like to think I know a thing or two about Thai food being that both of my parents spent a significant amount of time in Thailand as refuges from Cambodia; my mother cooking lots of Thai cuisine for us growing up. We frequently returned over the 6-years following. I even brought my brother and mother when they came down to visit. My brother raved about the fried rice and my mother extremely enjoyed the crispy duck. I think we've tried every appetizer on the menu and they're all superb with exception of the chicken satay which was rather bland and the coconut shrimp which was mediocre at best. However, our last experience this past Sunday was less than stellar. We had a reservation for 7:30 but did not end up being seated until 8:10ish. This was okay by us, we were there for prime dinnertime service. But it only went downhill from there. Our server never introduced herself. Then, when she took our order, she didn't go over the specials with us as is usually customary (at least it was every previous time we've been, the last only 6-months prior). We ordered the spring rolls, chicken bites, and coconut shrimp as appetizers. The spring rolls, while delicious, did not come with the lettuce for wrapping as they normally do. No bother. They were still yummy. The coconut shrimp, on the other hand, were, as stated before, mediocre. We did not even finish them. The chicken bites were awesome. But ...Then came our entrées. I ordered the pad siew with no bean sprouts. It came out and as I took my very first bite, I discovered what turned out to be a wadded piece of paper. It was sent back and a new plate was brought out, this time it had bean sprouts in it. Again, no worries, I just picked the bean sprouts out as, by this time, I was hungry. Someone, whom I'm assuming was the manager, came over to the table and pseudo-apologized. He stated that we'd be getting dessert on the house. Bleh. He didn't even stick around long enough for us to say thank you and decline, because I would have. We're not dessert people. At the end of our meal, a random dessert was brought out to us, without asking what we'd like.  It was flan. I detest flan. Luckily, I discovered, my daughter likes flan. But she's two. I only let her have a few bites (she had to go to bed at some point).Regardless, despite how hungry I was, I had some leftover and it was boxed up for us. Today, I attempted to eat the leftovers for a late lunch only to discover that the beef in my pad siew was covered with fat..I direct tweeted Thai Spice (along with a picture) and got the unsatisfactory response of it being a Groupon night -- whatever that means. Oh well, I suppose all good things must come to an end. It's such a shame because I really enjoyed them before, it seems, they got too big and important and acclaimed to focus on superior service and phenomenal food.

Reviews.Author: Danny H.
Reviews.Content: Excellent Thai! Ordered the pad Thai, so different from all the ones I've had and had Thai curry chicken, very spicy..but just the way I like it.. well deserved 5 star!

Reviews.Author: Vishal P.
Reviews.Content: This place is great. The menu is large and really has a huge variety. The food is perfectly cooked and comes out on time. We had 4 dishes and all of them were out of this world. The atmosphere is new and authentic Asian. Service was some of the best I've had. Drinks are amazing and unique. Try the seafood curry, Rock-n-roll calamari, Thai curry chicken, or Pad Tai

Reviews.Author: Meagan M.
Reviews.Content: Very good Thai food. I always get the Pad Thai because it is great! They have a huge menu so there is definitely something for everyone whether you're in a large party, business meeting or there for date night. I have been there for all three of those occasions and everyone leaves happy. I have always had good service there, but it is definitely pricier than the other Thai places in the area and on the weekends they ALWAYS have a long wait. Unfortunately these two things usually keep me out.TIP- Don't sit outside, whatever those trees/bushes they have out there are bug magnets. We were eaten alive in about 10 minutes out there until we asked out waiter to please move us inside.

Reviews.Author: Renee R.
Reviews.Content: On Friday night I went to Thai Spice. It was my turn to choose for date night...and I was in the mood for Thai...but didn't want to go too far from my house. After my meals, I usually want to sleep - don't judge me. So I asked my foodie sister to recommend some places. She did, but in the end decided to try a place that came highly recommend on Yelp - Thai Spice. Because it was Friday I called and made reservations for 8 to make sure that we wouldn't have to deal with the Friday rush.We got there a little early...7:45 to be exact, but figured we would just sit at the bar until it was time to eat. As it happened though, they seated us immediately...a two seater in the hallway. The place is decorated well, dark, with reds and booths, lighting is very dark and dramatic. We found out later that the space is quite small, but they used mirrors at the end of the rooms to make it appear larger. Don't expect bright light in here. The tables were lit with candles...we actually asked for a bigger one so that we could see our food better.Anyways, they gave us a list of the featured meals for the night AND their regular menu. The wine list is HUGE! I had a Lycheetini and He ordered Mangotini. The Mangotini was good...but the Lychee tini - Simply amazing. Clean crisp and they did not skimp on the Tini Part. Strong! We had two of those. On Drinks - I win!For the appetizer, he chose Seafood Coconut Lemongrass Soup - Medley of fresh shrimp, scallop, grouper, calamari, blue crab.  I had the Fresh Rhode island mussels - Simmered in a slightly spicy lemon grass broth with fresh basil and served with crispy naan bread. My Mussels were great - the sauce was sticky and sweet but delicious [all our food was ordered hot] you have a choice for the degree of heat you can have your meals at Mild, Medium Hot, and THAI hot.  Our server Marshall [ask for him - well spoken, attentive] explained it to us.Anyways I won on the drink choice - he did on the soup. It was delicious! We couldn't speak for a fewminutes after the first sip. A True medley of flavors - where none overpowered the other. It was fantastic.  - So much so that we had to stop eating it to so we would have a fair chance with the entrees.For the main meal I has shrimp red curry - Jumbo wild caught white shrimp sautéed in red curry paste, coconut milk, zucchini, bamboo shoots, peppers, asparagus and fresh Thai basil.  He has the Sea Food clay pot - Jumbo wild shrimp, fresh diver sea scallops and Maine lobster tail simmered in a clay pot with exotic Thai herbs, garlic, wine, chili sauce and basil.We both won on these...but we couldn't finish!! We had to take most of it home. I had a double shot espresso afterwards just to give me enough energy to get to the car.Please, please try this place. The space is smallish, but the food more than makes up for it. There are booths outside too if you're interested in sitting outside in this Florida weather.  The place was packed the entire time we were there, but you didn't feel overwhelmed by the traffic at all.  Great for date night, but for groups too.  We could have shared a meal...and they let you. There's a sharing fee!

Reviews.Author: Robert L.
Reviews.Content: Me and DaWife were craving for something very spicy. Since we pass this place everyday we figured the name was in our craving.We did not have any reservations and the place was packed but they did accommodate  us and fns us a table. this place was like a maze of rooms. and more rooms with aquariums everywhere. I love fish. Service was good, they seem to work in a team. Had steamed dumplings which were pretty good andI once again ordered the Chilean sea Bass with coconut, it was excellent. Great portion which came in a massive plate about 20" wide which was crazy.  5 stars all the way.They brought us their spice jars which was cute and impressive. The kids ordered phadsew which is the fat noodles but they brought somehting more like Phadthai which was just OK. Not worth the $18 a pop. I have had $5 much better. For this reason I gave the 4 star. After all it is a Thai restaurant and they should be serving $18 worth but I guess most don't know the difference.Would I go back. Not sure!!!!

Reviews.Author: Kristin W.
Reviews.Content: I went there with my husband for our anniversary. We started with the rock-n-roll and grilled calamari as our appetizers. Both were really good.As my main dish, I ordered the lobster pad thai. It is honestly the best pad thai I have ever had.My husband ordered the Long Island crispy duckling. It was phenomenal! My only issue was the salad. I tried the ginger dressing and peanut dressing, neither one I really liked.Overall, great place and we will be back

Reviews.Author: Anita C.
Reviews.Content: The best!  Haven't gotten a bad dish here ever.  Let me rephrase.  Everything I've ever tried here has been excellent.  The atmosphere is nice, maybe a little upscale but jeans and a nice shirt work fine.  Food is a little pricey but worth it.  They've expanded since i was there my first time some 7 years ago.  Parking can sometimes be a bear but they have valet and you can also park in the back.  Make sure to treat yourselves to an appetizer or two.  The thai wings have incredible flavor and that's the best thing about Thai Spice, the flavors to all of their dishes.  Love it!

Reviews.Author: Najah E.
Reviews.Content: The reviews on yelp helped. I had the shrimp Pad Thai. It wasn't as spicy as id want it. Also the shrimp was tasteless. I didn't even touch the shrimp. The Pad Thai was great. Just stay away from the shrimp if you're not into super fishy tastes. I could smell/taste the fish sauce and I found it repulsive. You won't find me here again.

Reviews.Author: Savanna M.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice is as good as it gets - between the food, service and atmosphere there is nothing wrong.  The fish tanks are a nice touch and exude character.   The servers are great and somehow manage to remember a very extensive specials of the day list which changes constantly.   They've recently expanded which is nice and they've added a happy hour during the week.  I have yet to check it out, but those 1/2 price apps are calling my name! Since this is close to where I work, we frequently come here for lunch, which pricewise is the best deal.  There are lots of lunch deals available with all of the standard thai options with a soup or salad (soup of the day, or salad with peanut dressing or ginger dressing) - pad thai, pad siew, red curry etc.   I'm particularily torn between the pad siew (which is the best I've ever had) or the crispy calamari which is great and not offered many places.   It's rare for us to get dessert, we're usually getting boxes to go because the lunches are so big, but if you have room there are some great options!

Reviews.Author: Keri H.
Reviews.Content: I just had one of the worst experiences at a restaurant ever. That is really tough to say as I have eaten at thousands of establishments all over the world.  To be clear, your food is delicious, your staff was incredibly kind to my 89 year-old grandmother, but the waiter who waited on us was one of the worst ever. First off, the waiter does not know the menu. Which is sad, when your job is to know the menu. My grandmother wanted to order soup w/ her Pad Thai and he told her she couldn't...when it clearly said it comes with soup on the luncheon menus. Then, my grandmother asks for a straw to share my tea, and he comes back with said straw and shoves it in her soup bowl. Because clearly, all old people want to sip up their hot soup from a straw. Just because she is in a walker, it doesn't mean she is paraplegic. She felt disgusted that he would generalize like that and that he would just plop the straw in her soup, without even handing it to her. Really weird stuff. Then, when *I* ask for the check, he makes a BIG DEAL to plop in front of her. Because clearly, as a  mixed-race black woman, I am either my grandmother's aid or too poor to pay. It was really uncalled for to have this waiter make an assumption of who was to pay. Usually, when the wait staff is properly trained, they place the check in the middle of the table. I leave my debit card with the waiter, and my grandmother watched as he swiped my card 3x in a row without a break. She couldn't believe it. And the he comes back and says that my card is declined...which is complete bullshit. I have plenty of money in my account and was just at the bank. I know my finances very well.  I asked for a read-out from the machine and he says the machine doesn't do that. I wanted proof that my card was declined and he just stared at me blankly. He said he ran it twice and it was declined and there was nothing he could do. Instead of giving access to any more of my cards, I pay cash and we leave. My level of trust is completely gone. On our way home, my bank calls to say that someone at Thai Spice/Tatton ran my card at least 3x. I have TWO charges of $27.40 deducted from my account. So I LOVE that he says my card is declined, while $27.40  went through twice. If I had no money in my account, clearly that wouldn't have happened. My bank says it would have gone through a THIRD time, but they halted the activity before the waiter could. I think your waiter needs to (a) learn the menu (b) take sensitivity training (c) learn not to generalize people and (d) learn how to use a credit card machine. He is not equipped to represent your establishment nor serve its guests.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany H.
Reviews.Content: BEST THAI AROUND!!! I've been coming here for a few years now and am never disappointed. We had a reservation for Valentines Day and did not have to wait long once we arrived. Once seated the waiter come over and and introduced herself but did not come back for a few minutes. The owner (I think, or manager)happened to be there that night and when she saw us waiting she immediately ordered another waiter to attend to us. Very nice, but it was Valentines Day and we did expect we might have a little wait to order and get our food and we were fine with that. I do not recall the name of the drink we ordered but the rim was coated with Habanero  Salt. WOW! I didn't even know it existed! So needless to say I ordered extra on my next round. Good Stuff. We usually just get a dumpling appetizer which is delicious but the seafood Tom Ka Gai soup is also so good. The Entrees are huge and although I usually to stick the chicken panang, I have also tried the Three buddies, the seafood red curry, and the Sea Bass. ALL AMAZING. My boyfriend loves steak and tells everyone about the dry aged cowboy steak here. If you are a steak lover, definitely try that.  I have managed to steal a few bites of his and it really is tasty. He also had the duck once and loved it, but I'm not a duck fan so I did not eat it, especially given that there are ducks walking around int he back parking lot sometimes lol. Over all it really is my favorite place to dine, great ambiance and great staff.

Reviews.Author: Ani S.
Reviews.Content: THANK YOU YELPers!! My honey and I dined at Thai Spice last night after some YELPers pointed out that Thai Spice had the elusive whole fried snapper my honey had been searching for.They definitely had it!!!  Thai Spice offers several options of fried fish, including choice of fish and choice of seasoning/sauce.   We were able to choose a choice of fish (Chilean Seabass, Salmon, Yellowtail Snapper, Sole, Key West Yellowtail, Whole Red Snapper, or Whole Hog Snapper) that could be prepared in two ways (crispy fried or oven roasted) then topped with a choice of sauces (Chili, Red Ginger, Red Curry, Hot Basil, Sweet & Sour or Thai Lemon Garlic Butter). We ordered a Crispy Fried Whole Red Snapper with Hot Basil sauce which turned out to be neither hot nor very basil tasting, good, but not great.   Next time we would probably try another sauce.   Note:   They accidentally brought out our fish with the Red Curry Sauce first and my honey sent it back for the Basil.  The Red Curry Sauce was much more flavorful, reminding us of a Penang Curry. Might try that next time.Nonetheless, this whole fish hit the spot!  My honey was thrilled!!!  Yay!!!We also ordered: - Bang Bang Beef - Volcano Shrimp- Spicy Ginger Carrot Chicken Soup Special- Fried Banana and Ice Cream DessertThe Bang Bang Beef was delicious and very flavourful.  Floured and Fried pieces of beef (skirt steak?) then drenched in a sauce.The Volcano Shrimp was tasty- whole large shrimp with a spicy chopped sauce smothered over it.  The sauce definitely had a bit of a spice and overpowered the shrimp itself, but was very good. The Spicy Ginger Carrot Chicken Soup was ok-- thick broth soup with minced chicken dumplings.   The Ginger and heat of the soup was a bit much-- I will not order again.  Fried Banana dessert was very good and typical of thai places.  Overall, a very good meal.  I don't even want to think about the calories!! ****Service was EXCELLENT!!  We brought our 1yo with us and they were sweet enough to seat us next to the fish tank which delighted him the entire evening!!! The bar had a lounge singer with an INCREDIBLE voice!!!   She sang a bunch of cover songs and I honestly thought the music was from the radio!!Prior Review:The skirt steak is DELICIOUS!!   Great place!If you seek delicious Thai, exotic foods, pairings and fresh seafood--- you FOUND IT!   Everything on their menu is amazing!   The food, atmosphere, service is all perfection! I have never had anything bad here!!!Takeout works well too!

Reviews.Author: Son V.
Reviews.Content: This place is good. However, it is very expensive though. The service is excellent. We went on Sunday night and they offered live singers. It was very lovely. Try their GRILLED SHRIMPS and SPECIAL FRIED RICE.

Reviews.Author: Mariam D.
Reviews.Content: I loved seeing the "Yelp" sticker in the window .. .along with the numerous plaques for the recognition Thai Spice has received over the years for its amazing food, intimate and chic ambiance, and excellent service.  The fish tanks are glorious ... step inside and you see the bar and Bamboo Lounge. Happy Boasts 1/2 price beer/wine/cocktails and 1/2 price appetizers with plenty to choose from.  I'll be back to try it out for sure, as my server said Thursday and Friday are their busiest Happy Hours of the week.  The dining areas continue, with high tops, booths, and table seatings in a warm and dimly lit setting ... an absolutely sexy ambiance that transports you to an exotic, tropical, faraway land.  The lunch menu is awesome and starts at just $8.50 for an extensive list of Thai specialties.  I have been wanting to revisit TS for lunch, and today was the day.  I had the Thai Beef Salad (from the salads section of the menu/third time ordering this) and the Red Curry with scallops and fried rice.  Delicious.  Tons of bamboo shoots, red and green peppers, green beans, and an amazing, creamy coconut curry sauce.  I have plenty left over for dinner later or lunch tomorrow.   There's outdoor seating and an outdoor booth. Yelpers: Thai Spice is so good!  You MUST try this Thai.

Reviews.Author: Cherir C.
Reviews.Content: This is a regular stop for us. Last week we used our groupon which was nice but not necessary because we've been going before Groupon(: My daughter always gets the satay. They bring a fire pot and cucumber salad with it. I try to order something new, but I ended up with chicken panang curry. It's the best I ever tasted. We did one thing differently this time! We had an amazing peanut butter dessert! Try it if you love peanut butter and chocolate!

Reviews.Author: Fred S.
Reviews.Content: I would have given this five stars because everything was really good. But, some dishes a little less authentic, given the fact that my wife is from Thailand and we've been married almost 40 years! Nevertheless, the dishes that may have been less than authentic still tasted excellent. People may complain about high prices, but the dishes served had excellent portions which is unusual for these kinds of restaurants which typically have very small portions.  It's also pleasant to have a very nice atmosphere in Asian restaurant and enjoy it as an evening out and a special night out. Absolutely going back again.

Reviews.Author: Ashley S.
Reviews.Content: Best Thai restaurant in Fort Lauderdale.  Always great, friendly service.   Food is very consistent and they have good nightly specials.  Thai Spice heat has a great kick too!

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: My parents recently dined at Thai Spice for their anniversary dinner. They bragged for weeks, so I had to go myself. I arrived on a weekday lunch around 12:30 to find the small parking lot packed to the gills with other cars hawking for a spot. After circling a couple times I saw a sign stating that there was more parking in the back of the restaurant. In the back I found at least 10 free parking spots. Because they were so busy and I was dining alone, I sat at the bar so that I didn't take a table that they probably could use for a larger party. The bartender, Shawn, quickly greeted me and laid a linen napkin out on the bar before he brought my jasmine tea and silverware. He was very welcoming and helpful in choosing an entree. His impeccable service contributed to the five-star rating. I probably haven't had such great service in years, not to mention in the lunch hour. He explained the history of the restaurant and I now understand that it started as a small takeout restaurant that expanded by slowly buying adjoining store spaces over the years. Looking at the restaurant they have created, I would have never guessed that it started as a takeout. The restaurant is very cut up with many private nooks and tables all decorated in Asian inspired black and reds. There are so many beautiful fish tanks, you are certainly guaranteed a view of one wherever you sit. I bet kids would love it here. I ordered the ginger salad and red curry with steak and vegetables(lunch portion). The homemade salad dressing was awesome, although I haven't had iceberg lettuce in a long time. I would have much preferred a hydroponic or leaf lettuce, but the dressing made the salad enjoyable. The entree was the star of the meal with slices of steak so tender they seemed to partially melt in my mouth. The vegetables were cooked perfectly as they were hot,  tender, and still with a bit of crunch. The sauce was the best Thai curry sauce I have ever had. It had a very complex flavor in that I tasted different spices and ingredients as I enjoyed each bite. Light coconut milk flavor, with Thai basil that gave the hint of anise or fennel. The large square plate was portioned with just the right amount of sauce that I didn't have a dry bite or a drop left, hehe (honestly, I would have considered scraping the plate).Between the awesome service, the beautiful decor, and the sauce that made me want to smack my momma, this place ROCKS!!! I am really looking forward to a dinner here.

Reviews.Author: Tully R.
Reviews.Content: Just west of Lauderdale by the Sea on Commercial, this well established Thai treat is worth a visit! The sesame wings are a delight as are the spring rolls, all the soups, and even the fried rice!

Reviews.Author: Cest L.
Reviews.Content: We were crazy enough to show up here Valentines night around 9:30.  And much to our surprise we were able to procure two seats at the bar for dinner!They have a great wine list along with some unique specialty drinks. We started our meal with thai spice spring rolls. They had such a wonderful flavor, just the right amount of chewiness and crunchiness. And the dipping sauces were a nice accompaniment. I ordered one of the specials offered, a mix of seafood served over crispy noodles with broccoli and bok choy. The seafood was cooked perfectly and the green items had a nice bright color to them.My partner had the shrimp pad thai, I am guessing that it was good since he ate the whole thing and did not save me a bite!Overall a very excellent meal!Will eat here the next time we are in Ft. Lauderdale!

Reviews.Author: Bradley T.
Reviews.Content: I feel like I've wasted the last 26 years of my life not eating at Thai spice. Thai spice not only serves the best Thai food in the history of my taste buds, but they sell seafoods and prime steaks cooked to perfection.Unfortunately my stomach has a spatial limit so I could only choose one dish. I had the seafood red curry with gigantic scallops, grouper fillet, calamari, and baby octopus. As a curry aficionado, I can tell you that it was the real McCoy and the seafood was cooked perfectly. My girlfriend tried the Siam duck with tamarind sauce and that was also otherworldly.The restaurant is expensive, no doubt, but the quality equals the high cost.I can't wait to go back and try the Lobster Pad Thai. Damn..

Reviews.Author: Brenda P.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice you won me over!Nestled in a small, ordinary looking strip mall you cannot miss the giant RED signage calling your name as you drive by. Had I been alone I might have kept driving thinking it was a little overboard. The friends we were with were absolutely sure this was the place for me and they were right. From what I was told, it has recently been remodeled. It is obvious when you pay close attention. You enter through the swankier new area. If you make a right once inside you can see the difference in decor. It is a family owned restaurant with the owner, wife and daughter being all hands on deck. I did something I rarely do: I let others lead the way and order for me. I know, I know, I really need to do this more often. This was a great first step for me because everything that came our way, and I mean every little morsel was delectable. This is what I we tried:Bangkok RollsCoconut ShrimpChilean Sea BassLobster Pad ThaiRibeyeSeafood Medley SoupSpecial Fried RiceWhite Chocolate CheesecakeCoconut Fried Ice CreamChocolate Peanut Butter MousseYes, all of that was for just four of us. It was our own version of  a "family style tasting menu". The portions are pretty large for the entrees and regularly sized for appetizers and desserts. Some things are Thai hot and others milder. If this is not your thing, make sure to ask prior to ordering. I do love "hot" so I was very happy. It's hard to choose a favorite but I would say the Bangkok rolls and lobster pad Thai were the most memorable for me. The chocolate peanut butter mousse was spectacular as well. Service was wonderful throughout the night. I am already planning a return visit very soon because I can't stop thinking about it. And that, is how I know I have been officially swept off my feet!

Reviews.Author: Mark B.
Reviews.Content: My favorite Thai restaurant. I have dined here a few a few dines and have not been disappointed. Everything I ate has been delicious. My favorite would be the skirt steak wow tasty. i

Reviews.Author: Roland R.
Reviews.Content: As someone who has eaten an excessive amount of Thai food all over the US and in Thailand (fyi - they just call it food there), at hole in the wall joints and fine dining establishments, Thai Spice is easily ranked in my TOP 3 for Thai!Don't let the location fool you, (in a STRIP PLAZA with a CHECK CASHING place right next to it.  Yes, I know, nothing screams MORE GHETTO than a check cashing place, well maybe a gun store), but Thai Spice is THE REAL DEAL!!!The food here is DIVINE.  Each dish is a CULINARY ADVENTURE that will make you wish you had TWO STOMACHS!  My FAVORITE is THE DUCK!  It's basically where HEAVEN MEETS EARTH!  It's fried to a crispy perfection and it's drizzled with a sweet- tangy, thick tamarind sauce SO MAGICAL that it can end the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.Thai Spice is on the pricier side but IT'S WORTH IT!  They use top-notch ingredients and great quality meats and the service is fast and friendly to boot!

Reviews.Author: Charmie P.
Reviews.Content: Well, to sum it up, everything is delicious.The fresh rolls, curry puffs, satays, wonton soup, my bf says the seafood tom yum is the best he's ever tried, I love the Tom Ka Gai soup, the skirt steak with jasmin rice, the pad thai...ok, if I continue I will just be listing the entire menu.  They are heavy on the spice so if you are like me and can't handle anything over medium make sure you tell them, they will season it to your request.  Also, they deliver which is a huge plus when you are looking for quality food from the comfort of your home.  I used to live close by and used to order delivery on a very regular basis, they were very constant on quality and freshness.

Reviews.Author: Danielle R.
Reviews.Content: Great Scotts I'm in LOVE!This place rocks- just go!!!I met a friend of mine here for lunch last week, she suggested it, as she knows my love of anything spicy.  I was a little tardy for the party, so when I walked in the hostess was expecting me and sat me where my friend was.Waitress was on it, super friendly, ubber attentive, changed my drink napkin 3 times, made jokes, she was great!  5 stars for a kickass server. So rare these days!I ordered some spicy chicken dish w/ a sweet and sour sauce and fried rice, my friend ordered the crispy tofu with veggies, all 'medium white girl spicy' b/c we requested the spices on the side. And boy did they bring over the condiment mother load, 4 containers of varying degrees of spicy wholesome goodness to add to our meals. Sweet baby Jesus was I happy.Food was amazing, flavorful, not too hot, well not until I got a hold of some of their pepper sauces.  Going back for sure!  They have outside seating and inside seating. Great music, and it's dark and romantic in a classy Thai way!

Reviews.Author: Samantha D.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice how my love for you wants to be there but just can't. First time going here we sat outside and it seemed as if our server kept forgetting about us and it seriously took an hour for our food to come out. This was forgiven because the food was delicious! Second time here my mouth was watering just to get in the door. We decided to sit inside this time to get a good feel of the restaurant. They sat us at a 6 top when it was just the two of us. Wasn't thrilled about it but now time to eat! My husband and I ordered the same thing as last time, the Vegetable Red Curry with Tofu and Beef Pad Thai. The servings are gracious but I just can't believe how expense it is. The ingredients are fresh and flavorful but you can get the same thing literally right down the road for half the cost! There just isn't anything I see that makes this Thai place any different than the other ones around town. The staff is friendly at best and the parking is super tight. Between our two visits this place just doesn't do it for us. Don't get me wrong the food is good and they have live entertainment but I would rather pay less for a family owned dining experience down the road that is much more cost effective, cozy and attentive!

Reviews.Author: S M.
Reviews.Content: Have been dining at Thai Spice for over ten years! Busier now then it's ever been! Recently, there seems to be a new chef, they've cut back on the quality and quantity of their food, or all of the above. We have been disappointed the last 3 or 4 times we have gone, hoping that the next would be better than the prior. Unfortunately, it hasn't improved. Steak was tough, chewy and not cooked to specification. Crispy fish sauce was too thick and not as tasty. One out of the 6 of us enjoyed their meal!Salad (dressing)spring rolls and soup still good.Don't want to give up on this place, but it's becoming less desirable.

Reviews.Author: Jamie A.
Reviews.Content: I had the seafood coconut soup, and whole yellowtail fish fried with a chili garlic sauce. Amazing!! This place is the best Asian food in Fort Lauderdale. You will not be disappointed. Alfred our server was professional and knowledgeable on all items on the menu. Don't miss a trip to this place. It is well worth every penny. Oh! And try the lychee-tini and mango-tini!!!

Reviews.Author: Lena P.
Reviews.Content: Love my Thai food, and this place was amazing!Nice restaurant decor inside and they have a live band/singer as well. The waiters were really nice and always there when we needed them.Appetizers: Chicken Nam Sod: Delicious! It's minced chicken with great flavors, I took seconds!Yum kai Egg salad: good dish for vegetarians as an appetizerEntrees: Chicken Basil: chicken was seasoned really well and the basil flavor was perfect. I took seconds!Veggie Fried Rice: rice was cooked perfectly and we only asked for eggs, onions, and scallions in it which was delicious.Veggie Panay Curry: the coconut curry sauce is really good - not too strong which complimented the vegetables in it. Great to put over rice.Veggie Pad Thai: tasted sweet, but I like sweet so it was good to me!Dessert: Cassava: It's a potato dessert, which tasted like a flan but it wasn't. It was good, but the waiter brought out a whole tray of desserts for us to choose from and although everything looked really good, we were so stuffed from our meal. Maybe next time!

Reviews.Author: Brian W.
Reviews.Content: The Thai green curry chicken and red curry pork are some of my favorite dishes.  I normally like things spicy.  I'd recommend medium on these 2 dishes.  The hot tends to be over powering.  The wine and bar selection are good.  The lighting and music make for great ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Kim K.
Reviews.Content: In town on business and really wanted Thai. Glad I found this place. Parked right out front and didn't have to wait. Service was very attentive and the decor and music were suitable.  I had a shrimp curry dish that was pretty good. I wished I would have asked for it spicier- my fault. I would go again, for sure.

Reviews.Author: Eve G.
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this place. The food is amazing. The staff are all friendly and very accomodating. If you love Asian food this is definitely worth going to.

Reviews.Author: Gil H.
Reviews.Content: Found this place on yelp, it was amazing, some of the best Thai food I ever had. Going back there tomorrow, got to try some more dishes!

Reviews.Author: Taylor Z.
Reviews.Content: I was super impressed with the food here. If you are not a meat/fish eater, the menu can look a little scary. However, I was reassured by our friendly waiter that most plates can be -veggie-ized. I had the best coconut soup in my life !! I got tofu instead of chicken. I also had an amazing sweet and sour tofu plate with lots of veggies.The service was fast and the prices were a little on the high side, but worth it.  I would definitely return here next time I am in Miami ... I can't wait!!

Reviews.Author: Bobi G.
Reviews.Content: Been here six times over the last 5 years and the last two times have not been as good as I remember it. This used to be my favorite "special occasion" restaurant, but no more. Food the past two times is hit or miss, when it is a hit, it's great. A miss and it's so so. Last time I was here was for my birthday and the service made our whole table uncomfortable. My father gave our order to the waiter who brought us garlic chicken instead of beef, and missed an entire dish we all heard my father definitely order. Mistakes happen which is not a problem, however the waiter told my father he did not order it! We were all shocked and uncomfortable. The waiter was such a jerk it really ruined our meal. Also, on our way out a mgr saw an unhappy look on my moms face and asked how everything was, my mom said a little disappointing. The waiter then told my mom, away from the mgr, 'you know I can lose my job for that". He should.

Reviews.Author: Jessie L.
Reviews.Content: I love Thai Spice, I've been coming here for the past 7 years or so. I'm not a big fan of Thai food elsewhere besides Thai Spice. The service and the food is always excellent. I usually get the chicken with baby corn and mushrooms when I come here, but recently tried the New York Strip Steak with rice and bok choy, but substituted the bok choy for shiitake mushrooms which were incredible. I'm looking forward to going back and trying some of their seafood because it looks amazing. Some of the people that I went with got the full Maine lobster and lobster tails and they said that it was impeccable.

Reviews.Author: Lakshmi R.
Reviews.Content: Food is Great. Ambiance is quiet and dark. Bit Expensive but worth it.... Go there if you want to impress somebody....

Reviews.Author: Jessica G.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice is pretty close to where I work, so I have been here quite a few times for lunch. I rotate between the pad thai and the pad siew, mostly because I love noodles so much I just can't seem pull myself away. The sweet peanut taste in the pad thai is perfect and the sweet soy sauce in the pad siew is amazing. They are totally willing to customize spice level, but I'm not that adventurous with spice so I always get mild.The other night I tried dinner here for the first time.   They offered a groupon a month or so back, so I snatched it up, a good opportunity to try dinner for essentially the price of lunch. I made reservations since it was Friday night, and I'm glad I did. The parking lot was quite full and we had to valet, and we did have to wait a few minutes for our table despite the reservation, but it wasn't long and I wasn't bothered by it.I started with one of their signature drink. This was the first opportunity I had to try anything from the bar since I've only ever been here when I have to be back at work. I don't remember the name but it was essentially an apple cinnamon martini...so good! and the taste reminded me of fall. We ordered the grilled calamari appetizer as well. I'm somewhat new to calamari, especially if its not fried, because the potential is had to be chewy scares me. This was was cooked perfectly, and the grilled/charred taste was excellent. It came with two sauces, one fairly spicy and one mild that went really well. For dinner I ordered pad siew and my boyfriend ordered pad thai. I somehow talked him into this because I really wanted to order both. The pad siew was perfect as usual. He ordered the pad thai spicier than I would normally, but trying it the flavor was really good and the spice went well with the peanut sauce, I just know I couldn't handle the whole portion. I love how the noodle dishes come with fresh bean sprouts on the side, they're great mixed it. I've always had good service here for lunch, and there was nothing really wrong with the dinner service, I just felt it had been more attentive on occasions I went during the day, but this is probably because they were busy. Overall I was pleased with the dinner, but I do have to say that lunch portions are not much different, and the price is lower and the dishes come with salad, so lunch is a better value by far. I'm dying to try the happy hour with the drink and appetizer specials, especially knowing now that their special cocktails and calamari appetizer are so good.

Reviews.Author: Chris A.
Reviews.Content: Two words to describe this place " THE BOMB".The chili fried calamari is the best calamari around, hands down. If you haven't eaten here then you are missing the BOAT. THE BOMB food.

Reviews.Author: Frizaley B.
Reviews.Content: This is the best Thai restaurant in SOFL. I live the Seafood Red Curry and the chicken wings. The service is nice as well.

Reviews.Author: Marqus R.
Reviews.Content: In Fort Lauderdale there are certain restaurants that set the benchmark for various cultural cuisines. Valintino's Cuicina Italiana for Italian, Eduardo De San Angel for Mexican, Rainbow Palace for Chinese, and for Thai, it's clearly Thai Spice. So, if I were asked what is the best Thai (like in really being Thai, not to be confused with those tagging themselves with the common catchall of "Asian") restaurant in Fort Lauderdale, my answer would be Thai Spice. What sets Thai Spice and the others I have mentioned apart is that each generally holds true to the highest, purest form of the specific cuisine of the country they represent without compromising or Americanizing; at least not markedly so.  In my experiences the staff at Thai Spice has always proved superior in attentiveness, courtesy and general competence. Adding to that is the delightful, dare I say elegant "sexiness" of the décor, oozing in comfort and ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Dan I. C.
Reviews.Content: Very few people can say that have been eating at this place when it was a small grocery store that rented Thai Movies. I can. Thai Spice reminds me of a caterpillar that transformed into a butterfly, just pure beauty. When I walked in the door the place oozed sexiness and elegance. The decor was very hip and even though I was having lunch it felt like night time in the restaurant. I had the spring rolls, steamed dumplings, Red Curry Chicken, a Delmonico Steak, and for dessert, the Mango Sorbet. All the food was excellent. The Red Curry Chicken was spicy hot as I ordered it. The heat was perfect and the coconut curry broth was F'ing delicious. Now for something that threw me for a loop was how good the steak was. What Thai restaurant serves prime beef grilled to perfection like this....I really had to think about it and no other Thai Restaurant came to my mind. The steak was served with a Tiger Tear sauce which was I think was a mix of soy sauce, fish sauce and some herbs. This sauce had a unique taste and gave the steak an interesting favor even though it tasted great without it. The mango sorbet was a perfect ending to a great lunch. Cool, refreshing, and sweet. Service was excellent. I can see why they recently won a Diamond Star Award. I highly recommend this place. It's not cheap folks and it shouldn't be. Great food, service, and ambiance has a price but Thai Spice is well worth it. Remember to tell the owner Michael , Dan sent you and Stay Hungry!

Reviews.Author: Joe C.
Reviews.Content: Food is good but you will experience the worst customer service. I am sure they are spending more money in marketing than in employee training.

Reviews.Author: Richard K.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Thai places in South Florida.The place has very fitting cultural decor. The ambiance feels intimate with a dimly lit dining area and quiet music in the background.The service is fantastic. Waiters are knowledgeable and work diligently at making your experience memorable.The food is amazing. They have the best calamari appetizer. Oh, Crispy Calamari how delicious you are! Everything I have ordered here has been spot on and the people I have gone with has enjoyed this restaurant as much as I have.A good date place.

Reviews.Author: Iris N.
Reviews.Content: Overpriced.  I have to say that I had high hopes of it being delicious from other yelp reviews, but you are paying for a lot of fish tanks to be well stocked and kept. I did my culinary training in South East Asia, so if there is one thing that I know it is Thai food. This is okay, but nothing that stood out except the check. For the price of the dishes I would have expected some creativity on the chefs part. This was more fusion pricing. If you want thai Tee-jay is along the same price, close in proximity, and better; plus you can get great sushi at Tee-jay.

Reviews.Author: Mitchell M.
Reviews.Content: The last two experiences here in past 2 weeks have been horrible. Came on a Sunday night and then Tuesday lunch with clients.Sunday night had Chiang Mai chicken normally one of my favorites here. Horrible that night. Weird story too. The to use the manager's words Caucasian manager was talking to a table of two ladies one from Jamaica. He mentioned that since he has been hired they have hired primarily "Caucasians" and then told another worker that he liked the word. Also heard him say they only had two Thai servers even though it is a Thai restaurant - bizarre.  Thinking Sunday was an off night came back Tuesday and had dreaming chicken deep fried chicken with peanut sauce- horrible. I'm going to give it the benefit if the doubt and say it must be that their head chef is on vacation. But regardless extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Cristina W.
Reviews.Content: Loved this Thai restaurant. It was authentic, romantic, chic, etc.. It had it all, except for the bad parking.  We were lucky to find a spot, because there is barely any parking, and if not, it's cash only for valet.  Other than that, I'm glad I had reservations, because if not, there is a 3 hour wait on Fridays.  The service was excellent and so was the food.  We ordered sesame wings to start with, that were perfectly crisp on the outside, but full of meat.  I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai, that had crumbled peanuts laid perfectly on top of the food, and added a special touch.  I will definitely recommend this place for someone looking for a Thai restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Lor L.
Reviews.Content: We have frequented Thai Spice for years, and it has gone through a few phases with the service. It's back to having excellent service now. The food here has always been spectacular. They are the best Thai on the east side of Ft. Laud, and they know it! Unfortunately, as many other places have done, they raised their prices. The Pad Thai is now $16.95--about $3 higher than other Thai restaurants.  On the plus side, their takeout menu is about $3 cheaper per dish than the eat-in menu. And of course, you do get  a nice leftover portion to take home.The portions are very large. Atmosphere is dark, classy, and romantic with fish tanks all around the restaurant. This is the kind of place that you can get dressed up a little bit and fit in very well with the crowd that dines there. Are the prices worth it?? Yes. While other Thai restaurants make thier food sweet just to appeal to the American crowd, Thai spice still sticks to being traditional.  This is our go-to place when we have a special occasion, or just have a little more money in the bank than usual. This is where you go to DINE, savor the food, and relax. We will continue going here. If you haven't tried Thai Spice yet, do yourself a favor and go to have a memorable night with friends and family.

Reviews.Author: Andy M.
Reviews.Content: Good apps, but entrees need work. These were lunch specials, so I am willing to give them a bit of a break. But still, there's no excuse for watery cashew chicken or a less than flavorful curry. On the app front, Mee Krob was surprisingly good and the spring rolls were nice, if small and a bit greasy.Elegant atmosphere and good service. A bit pricey for lunch, but I'd definitely go back for either lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Author: James L.
Reviews.Content: Came across this place while working in the area.  I ate from there twice while working in the area. Once at the establishment and once at the hotel I stayed at (they do offer  delivery).   A lot of my  liking or not liking a place is on the service. This place had friendly and prompt service. I ordered the THAI STUFFED CHICKEN WING  with the sweet chili dipping sauce and the THAI BARBEQUED FREE RANGE CHICKEN.Also definitely try the Glass Noodles. If you've never had these give them a try, quite a pleasant surprise. These items are without a doubt  some of the best food I've eaten  from a Thai  restaurant hands down.  If I'm ever to make it back to Fort Lauderdale I will make it a point to return to this place.

Reviews.Author: Keith H.
Reviews.Content: Best Thai in South Florida by far.  Service is excellent, attentive and knowledgeable.  Everyone I take here loves it.  Decor is appropriate and romantic.  Fish tanks are awesome, my little nieces love them.  Always get a good laugh listening to the waiter go through the 100+ specials they have everyday.  Items I love:1.  Skirt Steak.  Perfectly cooked and the Tiger Tear sauce is amazing.2.  BBQ Chicken.  So different and better than any other BBQ chicken I have had.3.  Peanut anything.  Pad Thai, Peanut Chicken, Salad with Peanut Dressing4.  Grilled Calamari.  So fresh, served on a mini grill thingy.  Amazing sauce.5.  Deserts.  I think they get them from a local bakery and they are very good.  Join their mailing list, they send you coupons.

Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn M.
Reviews.Content: This location has been around for many years.  Thai Spice has made the list for one of my favorite Thai restaurants in Broward County.  They have many options for vegetarians and vegans.  Not only that, ask to replace the meat in any dish with tofu, and they have your back!The outside of this restaurant is a little misleading to how amazing it is inside.  Inside the restaurant is a nice relaxing and intimate atmosphere.  You come here casual or a little dressed up on a nice date night.  Either way, you'll what they have to offer.If you sign up on their mailing list, they send you a letter for a free entrée on your bday.

Reviews.Author: Dawn B.
Reviews.Content: Always on point! Mr. Tatton got everything right and expanded in these times, and that speaks volumes. I salut him on creating a terrific dinning experience from start to finish. Nothing is overlooked.

Reviews.Author: Thomas S.
Reviews.Content: A good friend of ours from FTL took us to this place to get what he called "THE BEST THAI IN TOWN".   After dining there, I would have to agree that it was exceptional.   I had the Pad See Eiw, of course and my only complaint was it was prepared with thin noodles rather than the thick/flat type.   The spices were good and level of hot was just as ordered. I sampled the Pad Thai from a friend and found that very good, as well as the Panang Shrimp.   A bit more expensive than the traditional thai restaurants, however you get a much more enjoyable atmosphere to dine in.

Reviews.Author: Eye F.
Reviews.Content: I guess my review is a bit outside the popular views. I've lived and holidayed in the Far East, including Thailand for years. I eat Thai food in the USA frequently. Thai food this is not. Strikes me a Chinese with some Thai spices thrown in. Heavy, thick sweet caramelized sauces is not what I think of as Thai cooking. Onto the meal. Party of 4. Of four appetizers, the crab cakes were excellent, all the others were picked at and mostly left uneaten. Of the entrees, the duck was eh, nothing special. All 3 fish dishes had the texture of precooked fish that had been sitting on a steam table for hours and fast cooked to warm them up. The fish was dried out and mushy. Service was incompetent. I'll let this one go, it happens in this area all too often. All 4 of us decided Thai Spice was not worth a second visit. It's not bad, but its hardly Thai, the portions are way too large, the dishes heavy and sticky sweet and the cooking poorly executed.

Reviews.Author: Moi M.
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this restaurant.   Besides the fact it has the best Thai food in south Florida, the staff is extremely nice, friendly, attentive and always close by if you need something. It's worth the drive from Miami or Palm Beach if you want excellent delicious Thai food with excellent service.

Reviews.Author: Silvina S.
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband for our anniversary and was very good. The fish was great and the appetizers as well. The filipino dessert, cassava cake, was to die for. My daughter LOVED all the fish tanks. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: The place is a Thai food JACKPOT. It is truly amazing to have this caliber restaurant in Broward.. All the Thai is solid, but the craziest thing about this place are the steaks. They are amazing, some of the best steaks around. Below are some recommendations: ...Hot and sour soup - some of he best around, all fresh ingredients and not too spicy ...Rock and roll - amazing spring rolls, with real piece of shrimp, not the minced stuff you usually get ...Middle neck clams - JACKPOT - the best I have had here. They were big, juicy and fresh. Why can't more restaurant pay for better high quality clams? ...Stuffed chicken wings - weird to look at, but very flavorful and very fried ...Strip steak - BEST steak around and perfectly matched with a spicy sauce and bok choy ...Seafood curry - Amazing curry taste, fresh scallops and shrimp - this is an easy winner Portions are huge, don't be a piggy and share family style. This place gives hope to all Asian restaurants in the state of Florida. Service was fast, friendly and fantastic - this is going on a bunch of my "Best of..." lists. BONUS TIME: This place is fast, they can get you in and out within 45

Reviews.Author: Jamie C.
Reviews.Content: Do you want mouth-watering Thai food? Then this is the place for you!!! I love everything about this restaurant. The atmosphere is great, and the service is impeccable. Some of my fav dishes include: the Volcano Shrimp, Garlic Calamari with Bok Choy, and the Sea Bass, yum yum. Perfect place for a first date or an anniversary. Rated high on Zagat for a reason!! Oh, and a reservation is advisable for faster seating

Reviews.Author: Jeremy B.
Reviews.Content: I've been here several times for lunch with coworkers. Agree that it's a great place to introduce someone to Thai food, and for a business lunch. The thai food does not seem the most authentic ever, but that doesn't mean it's not of very high quality and very good. We went here again today, the waiter "recommended" a steak or the lamb chop entrees for lunch. Both are around $30. Instead, since we were at a Thai restaurant and came there for Thai food, we all ordered Thai food from the lunch special menu! I bet the steak is good, though.
