Prices on that lunch special menu range from about $8 to around $13. Most other entrees are more expensive. The Pad Thai (also around $10) is good, but not on that menu, so it doesn't come with anything. Whereas the lunch special items come with rice and either the soup of the day or salad. The soup today was hot 'n sour: pretty standard but good. Service is friendly, sometimes a little slow but that didn't surprise me because they were packed for lunch as usual.  Agree with another reviewer's recommendation to get there before 12 or after 1 and avoid Friday's. Parking can be a hassle and sometimes there's a wait.Regarding today's food, a coworker had the panang curry ($9.95), which had a delicious coconut milk sauce and vegetables such as asparagus, green and red peppers, onions, mushrooms, etc. I got the same dish but paid the extra $2 for shrimp, and was not disappointed. The shrimp were good size and tasty. All four of us who dined asked for our meals medium spicy and agreed that it was just enough kick to give it a pleasantly-spicy taste but to not be uncomfortable. Thai Spice may be a tad bit pricy and slightly americanized, but if you want a nice dining experience and above average thai food, it's a good bet.

Reviews.Author: Rhonda H.
Reviews.Content: Hooray! The great food is back! The restaurant had lost its way for awhile, serving less than stellar dishes but after last night's visit, I'm happy to report the standard for great Thai cuisine has been reinstated. This is the best that it gets. Great sauces, quality food cooked to perfection! Fish dishes are a must try, along with most of the appetizers, chicken bites and coco shrimp being my favs. Crispy calamari will have you addicted for sure! Great staff, great waitering and beautiful surroundings add to the pleasant dining experience. Couldn't give 5 stars because of the limited and paltry wine selection (definitely not what it once was) but as far as the cuisine, this will, for sure, be a "happy ending."

Reviews.Author: Melinda E.
Reviews.Content: Freakin' Delish! Curry puffs to start and scallops basil as the entree...manifique! Great service and ambiance. I will definitely come back when I am in the area!!!

Reviews.Author: Ken G.
Reviews.Content: I've been there twice since it's my mother-in-laws favorite Thai restaurant. However, I found the food on both occasions bland, flavorless, and quite over priced. I won't return unless my wife threatens me with divorce, and then I'll have to give it some thought.

Reviews.Author: Michelle M.
Reviews.Content: Yum! The green curry was GREAT and the bacon wrapped chicken app was delish too! The service here is top notch. Perfect for a first date! It seemed like a lot of regulars were eating there. Try it out!

Reviews.Author: Bianca L.
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful little restaurant!We went in last night around 9pm after reading reviews about restaurants in the area (which we don't know much about). Thus, my mother and I made our way to Thai Spice. The place was almost empty, but dark and quaint. It was especially comfortable on the booth.  We ordered the following off the menu:Appetizer: Two Thai Spring Rolls (AMAZIIIING), and two Vegetarian Spring Rolls. The sauces that come with the rolls are really tasty, to the point where we'd use a spoon to eat the remaining sauce off the bowl.Entrées: My mother ordered a vegetarian pad thai, which she LOVED. I ordered the fried calamari over brocoli, and sweet corn in a pepper and garlic sauce. I have to say... I did not like it, but my mom loved my dish. IMPORTANT: I didn't care much for the pepper taste because I am a difficult eater when it comes to Asian food. The restaurant cooked my dish very well and I am sure it is a very popular dish. It was just my own preferences...They have quite an amazing list of wine and spirits. We did not have anything but water and tea because we were driving... But I really can't wait to go back! Even if it's just for the spring rolls! The Thai Spring Rolls were tastier than the Veggie rolls.It really is a great place in the middle of Fort Lauderdale. A little pricey for the type of food... but a quaint place.

Reviews.Author: Kerrie M.
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for excellent Thai food, a lovely atmosphere, and excellent drinks, this is the place for you!  This was simply the best Thai I have had in SoFL! Their cocktails were perfect, everything on the menu was terrific! The only thing that was a bit off-putting was the constant barrage of questioning... It was pretty hardcore compared to other places. Apart from the typical "can I get you anything else" type of question, which is to be expected maybe once or twice, these were constant. It interrupted the same brief but important conversation more than 5 times, and the waitress (and two other restaurant employees) asked my b/f if he wanted another beer (no exaggeration) more than 10 times in the last 15 minutes that we were there before getting the check. While this was frustrating, the food was great! I may go back if I am in the area, though I will know better for next time to try and leave certain conversations that should have minimal interruption for a more intimate venue.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy A.
Reviews.Content: I will never return here. I've been there twice and both times were crappy.  The second time instead of getting one major entree we ended up getting various appetizers to try a lot of their menu options. unfortunately everything tasted the same and they were all dried out.  There is nothing special here.

Reviews.Author: Jessica S.
Reviews.Content: This is the best Thai food I have ever eaten(other than Thailand), kidding, never have been there. Would love to though. The ambiance is quaint and personal, the staff is friendly and helpful. If you have never eaten Thai food, it is kinda tricky to order.... Even the least spicy is slightly spicy. The three buddies is my fav and I order it every time I dine here. Not to mention the amazing soups;different flavors all blended perfectly!!!! To die for. Hands down the best Thai in Ft.Lauderdale.

Reviews.Author: Christina P.
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Thai restaurant and went for my first time with a group of friends. All of the dishes at our table were mouth watering, (I tried all of them!) Everything here is cooked and prepared with fresh fish and ingredients and it truly shows. We had satay chicken and coco shrimp for starters. For my main dish, I chose the shrimp with cashews plate and it was sooo delicious! The flavorful sauce and water chestnuts in this plate made the meal so satisfying! Although the dessert was forgettable and they didn't have Thai donuts (my favorite) and were playing hip hop music in the background...everything else was superb about this restaurant experience!

Reviews.Author: Carla M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing every time I go. The fish is always fresh.My personal favs: Tom Ka Gai, Calamari and Sea Bass. The pad thai is delicious as well!An absolute must if you have not been!

Reviews.Author: Kathy M.
Reviews.Content: I've been eating at Thai Spice for about 15 years.  It used to be a treat to go there - the food, the service and the ambiance all exuded elegance.  I have no idea what has happened in the last couple of years, but from now on, I'll happily drive the extra 1.1 miles to the other Thai restaurant on Federal Highway.We were there a couple of Wednesdays ago.  It was Karaoke night. (Short sentences for dramatic effect - I'm trying to think of something polite  say.....) Now, I'm not a big fan of Karaoke, but I recognize many others are.  Fine.  And I enjoy live music when the musicians are, are, well, top-notch.  But is it too much to ask, in a "destination" (that adjective is on their website) restaurant that has four distinct rooms, to have regular music where people are eating, and keep the (abrupt colorful adjectives deleted to continue to be polite) "singing" (oops...couldn't help myself) confined to the bar area?  C'mon? Please?  For three blissful minutes the "singer" paused and the music switched to something current, professionally assembled and pleasant.  So I had three good minutes in the evening, otherwise, the ambiance sucked, er, I mean, had an air of 70's throw-back crossed with high school talent show.My apologies in advance to any waitstaff there who take their jobs seriously.  Unfortunately, we weren't seated in your station.  I wish we had been.  The man who swept us off the entry threshold almost prevented us from a bad evening.  He was so pushy and unaccommodating, if he hadn't finally seated us in the dining room after showing us two different tables in the exceedingly loud and completely customer-desolate bar after we repeatedly asked for "a quiet table where we could talk," we would have walked out before even being seated.  Alas, we were paraded thru the entire restaurant  and given a table next to the kitchen.  Nothing says "quiet romantic evening" quite like a banging kitchen door and constant foot traffic.And that was just the beginning - it gets worse!  Our waiter and his little helper were two of the least professional waitstaff I have ever encountered in a restaurant where you don't retrieve your food off of a counter after your name is called.  Our drinks - nothing fancy, just Thai iced teas - took about 13 minutes to arrive.  By this point, we knew what we wanted to order, but Mr. Waiter insisted on reciting the specials.  After the unwarranted litany, we ordered the veggie red curry and grilled organic free range chicken.   Yes, the food took an inordinately long time to arrive.  When it did, the presentation was disappointing.  The curry was served family style.  The chicken and its accoutrements adorned a platter sized for a Viking king.  This doesn't look awkward in front of a guy with wide shoulders, but ladies, don't go there - you'll look like a troughed hog. Despite both meals being ordered "medium spicy, " they were both not at all spicy.  They tasted fine, but nothing warranted the prices. The baby bok choy with garlic was perhaps the highlight.Twenty minutes ~after~ we placed our silverware in the 4 o'clock "we're finished" position and pushed the plates to the end of the table, Mr. Waiter checked in to see if everything was ok.  "Yes, we've finished. The check please."  Ok - check this out!  Mr. Waiter left our table carrying one little glass and we waited another five minutes for his little helper to cart away the rest of the plates.  Seriously!  Has anyone ever seen that before, because I certainly haven't.  Then, the little helper comes back and interrupts our conversation to request I hand him a spoon that was tucked away by the salt and pepper.  Really?  You want me to help clear the table in a "destination" restaurant?  After the ten minute clearing process (thirty minutes now since we finished eating) Mr. Waiter comes back to ask if we want dessert.  "No thank you, just the check please." (Didn't we ask for that ten minutes ago?) Finally, we do get the check.  But!  We also get a spiel about birthday specials and filing out comment cards.  Let me emphasize this: birthday specials and comment cards in a "destination" restaurant.  Wow.There is a reason why there are no accolades past 2010 on their web page .  I don't know what that reason is, a change in ownership or management, perhaps?  But the accolade-givers have known all along what I just experience first hand. Thai Spice is a "destination" alright - the kind you warn all your friends about.

Reviews.Author: Adam K.
Reviews.Content: Best green curry I have had in the Miami/Fort Lauderdale area. If you have ever had green curry in Thailand, you will know what I mean. If you make the curry right, it makes all the difference. It wasn't on the lunch menu but I asked if it was available and they obliged. This one didn't have the thai eggplant and long beans but they substituted zucchini, asparagus (and some snow peas) and it turned out great. The salad that came with it was pretty standard, but had a peanut sauce on it. Not bad.I will be returning to try other dishes as they seem to use authentic (and delicious) recipes. When my co-worker suggested we go to Thai Spice, I assumed it would be a hole in the wall take out place. Nope. This is a full on restaurant, sort of dark inside, with a hostess. Good service. No complaints really. They also have outside seating.Parking was tough during the lunch hour. There is another lot behind and to the east of the restaurant if you are looking for additional parking, but you have to pull out of the main lot and use the next driveway to get there.

Reviews.Author: Shehnaz H.
Reviews.Content: The best thai food you will experience is located here in ft Lauderdale. I've lived many places in the country and the pad thai here is the BEST.  My family and I have been coming here for many many years before they expanded and it has stayed authentic, accommodating and of course delicious. Michael the owner is extremely kind and gracious as well as his staff. After yrs of dining here, we have a few favorites that we always order no matter what..... Pad thai ( we order as an appetizer to share with the table) so that we can order entrees as well. The pad thai is a must. Penang, massman, and sweet and sour shrimp.  I'm so happy that this restaurant has done so well and really deserves it. They have made us feel like family over the years and I'm sure you will enjoy too!

Reviews.Author: Bill S.
Reviews.Content: Really good Thai food.I like the coco shrimp appetizer, garden salad, and Pad Thai for lunch or dinner and it really is good.The only problem with this place is the lack of parking.

Reviews.Author: Kat T.
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't call this Thai.Well, not the usual sort of Thai. I was really in the mood for utterly Thai, and this was all about the "Angus beef" and wine pairings. A bit too far along the accomodating non-Thai fine diners spectrum for what I wanted that night. It's really intended as an "impress your dining partner(s)" sort of place.That said, the crispy calamari appetizer was done really well, and so was the fried whole yellowtail snapper. The only major issue was that the snapper was far too small - it could have been an entree for one - not the thing one expects when ordering a whole fish. Also - "medium" was really bland.The many fish tanks entertained the tykelet, and the staff seem to be welcoming of young diners - surprising given their menu. (We saw another table with a kid in a stroller as we left.)

Reviews.Author: Darryl S.
Reviews.Content: We've been putting this one off for quite some time simply because of it's cost.  (Personally, Thai food should be cheap, or relatively inexpensive; paying $30-$40 for a Thai meal is just not something we're too keen on doing, esp. considering how cheap great meals are in Thailand.  That said, it was time to cash-in one of our "special night" chips....)To start, I felt seriously underdressed for this place, as the whole vibe was definitely on the high-end side of the ambiance scale.  Fortunately, this IS South Florida, so even in some of the fanciest of restaurants, casual is cool.  I felt like we were going into some chic opium den:  Lots of exotic-looking woods, numerous large-scaled fish tanks, embellished portals leading to various dining niches, striking artwork, wall art and sconces, and some seriously low-key lighting.  (This was, I think, the darkest restaurant I've ever eaten in.  Fortunately, our table was next to a fish tank, so the lighting helped to illuminate my menu; I had to run out to the car to get my reading glasses.)  Our waiter greeted us almost immediately, and, thus, began what would, indeed, become a special dining experience...!Started off with a couple of Thai beers (Singha), which arrived icy cold with chilled glasses.  For appetizers, we ordered the fresh rolls ($10.95), along with an order of the crispy calamari ($15.95) (my personal litmus test for restaurants that serve this dish).  To our surprise, the fresh rolls arrived quickly.  Also to our surprise, at 11-bucks, these fresh rolls were sadly bland:  the rice paper wrapping was a bit under-cooked and chewy, and the chef used Surimi (imitation crab meat -- the pink stuff) instead of the real thing.  (Personally, it should've just been left off; we were both disappointed, mostly because of the price and expectation.)  That said, the presentation was beautiful, the dipping sauces (one sweet/sour; one peanut) were tasty, and (overall) it was a wholly-decent fresh roll.  Concurrently, the crispy calamari arrived; this was NOT your normal batter-dipped and deep-fried deal!  The plate arrived with a large mound of glistening, red-speckled, slices of squid tubes and tentacles:  no extraneous embellishments.  OMG, this dish was extraordinary!!  I could've simply had this as a meal (with a side of steamed rice) and would've been happy as a clam in a sea bed...!!!  (There was a restaurant in Atlanta that, for many years, took the top spot for fried calamari in my book; Thai Spice has now roared to overtake that spot!)  Even at 16-bucks, I would've ordered another; it was worth every penny!For entrees, my partner ordered the Cowboy Rib-Eye meal ($39.95 -- a hefty chunk o' change, indeed!), and I ordered the Three Buddies dish ($24.95), which is a dish consisting of jumbo shrimp, diver's scallops, and chicken, all simmering in a red-pepper sauce, over some veggies.  The presentation, too, was beautiful and vivid.  The flavors were amazing!  Chicken slices were super tender, diver's scallops were humungous and perfectly cooked, and jumbo shrimps were, indeed, jumbo, plump and tender, as well.  (My only negative is the fact that it was served with its tails still on.)  Mi amigo said his steak meal -- the massiveness of the dish was quite the eye-opener! -- was excellent and well-worth the price.Unfortunately, we were both stuffed at the end, and simply did not have any room for dessert, which our waiter presented to us to view on a platter.  (All looked amazing!)  This was first-class dining all the way...!  Only other negative was the $6.50 charge for the beers -- 4 beers at $26! -- which, in our opinions, was exorbitant, esp. considering it was simply Thai bottled beer that can be had anywhere else at $3-$4....  I suppose these prices are required for the overhead, including the super wait staff....  This place gets 4-1/2 stars -- the 1/2-star deficit is for those overpriced beers and mediocre fresh rolls....  :)

Reviews.Author: J B.
Reviews.Content: Oh Yea this place ROCKS!!!Went here last night, definitely recommend getting a reservation. It was pretty packed. Nice atmosphere, dimly lit. Service was perfect. Food... OK where to begin.Appetizer.... The stuffed chicken wing. They remove the bone of the biggest chicken wing I've ever seen, then fill it like a dumpling with pork, clear noodles, and various thai herbs and spices with a chili dipping sauce. Holy Crap... YUM!Coco Shrimp dipped in tempura batter and rice noodles and served with the most very light velvety honey mustard sauce, best I've ever tasted. Drink: Thai Ice Tea, another yum and my new favorite drink... Lemon Drop Sake-Tini  (Martini made with Sake) Hallelujah!!!!!Now for the main course...Triple Main Lobster Tails in a Thai Garlic Lemongrass butter sauce and vegetables. Words can not express how amazing this dish was. But the lack of words can... my friend and I sat there all of sudden speechless, there were occasional moans of ecstasy coming from us but that's about it. It is on the pricey side, but for original prepared dishes, Thai dishes that are created a little outside of the normal thai box makes every penny worth it, especially matched with great service, and a very extensive menu.

Reviews.Author: Anthony G.
Reviews.Content: Adequate, clean and has good service.  But not the best.Lunch prices are reasonable; otherwise, it is somewhat pricey.  Food is good, although a bit bland.  ("Medium" was VERY mild for example.)  Food was good, but not spectacular.  Panya Thai on 163rd is a LOT better in all respects and is about the same price.

Reviews.Author: Jeff P.
Reviews.Content: This place was not for me. I felt the food was very Americanized and not authentic. It's almost like a fusion steak house-thai restaurant-seafood restaurant as opposed to an authentic Thai restaurant. For example, they serve steaks, pork chops and seafood in addition to Thai food.  They also serve dishes that are popular in Asia in general such whole fried fish which is very popular in China. They also serve salads with some of their meals. I didn't care for the ambience. I feel the restaurant is too small and I felt claustrophobic. The tables were too close together and I could hear the conversation of the people seated behind me. The waiting area is tiny in my opinion. There were not enough seats and we stood for nearly 45 minutes waiting for a table. Speaking of which, I would definitely not recommend this place for families particularly for those with small children as there is little space for strollers and the long waiting times would make your night very challenging.  The place is located in a tiny strip mall so the parking is also limited. Many people have to wait for others to leave before getting a spot. Finally, the service was pretty lackluster. Our waiter was not very attentive nor friendly. The food was  good but not great. The pad thai had too much egg and peanuts. Their curries and sauteed dishes were very watery with overly large thick chunks of vegetables. Nonetheless, for me, it's too much trouble to dine here. I'm not willing to drive to Oakland Park and compete for parking in a tiny strip mall and then wait another hour in line for pretty good but not great Thai food. I don't really care about wine pairings and unique salads when I approach Thai food. I think the main reason it is so popular is there are not many quality Thai restaurants in the area, and their lounge vibe really works for many people. I think it's a great place to impress a date but for a Foodie seeking the very best Thai food, I think you will be a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Deborah R.
Reviews.Content: I have been eating here since 1992 and still love the Coco Shrimp and Grouper in Thai Basil Sauce.  My only disappointment last week was that they have changed the coconut ice cream and fried banana dessert.  It used to be with actual bananas cut into bite sized pieces.  Now they use plantains and only 4 pieces, but they just do not taste the same as the bananas!  I hope they decide to stay with their original dessert -don't cut the quality after all these years!!!

Reviews.Author: Daisy P.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best ! Just got done celebrating a friends birthday here and I am so glad he chose this place. The decor is very nice and I love the many different fish tanks that create light and movement in every room. The service was spot on. Always refilling our water glasses and not overly fawning. The cripsy calamari and grilled calamari were really good. I ordered the Shrimp pad thai and fiancee had the special of the day (Sea Bass with Curry sauce) Wow! the presentation and flavors of the two dishes were amazing and well composed. The kid at our table took a liking to the orchids and decided to eat them.... To end the night we had the peanut butter & chocolate mousse cake and it was heavenly. Cannot wait to go back. Even got to meet the owner who stopped by our table!!

Reviews.Author: Becky D.
Reviews.Content: Upped my star level because this is still the best Thai food that I have found in South Florida. I have been a couple more times and it is consistent with always good food and service. If I could afford to eat here more often I would! Compared to west coast Thai food... well it wouldn't be getting 5 stars, but this is as good as it gets when compared to local competition. I hardly ever give 5 stars and I'm still not sure if it's the right thing to do in this case LOL if 3-stars is average, then most places should be getting 3 stars! Thai Spice is awesome- I'm a fan!

Reviews.Author: Jackie S.
Reviews.Content: Wow I ordered the shrimp fried rice and it was delicious, the shrimp was grilled to perfection and tasted really fresh. Can't wait to go back there again...

Reviews.Author: Janis R.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice has always been several cuts above other Thai restaurants from a food and service perspective. But with the recent expansion, bar, entertainment and valet parking, they have upped their game, elevating the entire experience. They've even fixed the backwards entrance/exit issues with the parking lot. From the moment you pull up at valet, to the ever-gracious Mary Ann at the hostess desk, to the accommodating servers and chef, this is pure Thai heaven. And, listen up vegans...They don't look at you like you have two heads when you ask the chef to take out this or add that in so this is a great place to go with everyone without sacrificing your own dining pleasures. I get the vegetable Pad Thai minus the egg and fish sauce and add steamed tofu or the  vegetable Penang curry (minus the fish sauce) plus steamed tofu and brown rice.  You can ask them to do a vegetarian fresh roll if you want an appetizer. And the peanut dressing is not to be believed!  Portions are ample so if you want Thai for breakfast the next day, you won't be disappointed. Call to make a reservation. They're not on open table. Then go. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Author: S F.
Reviews.Content: Great first experience. Got the calamari, wonton soup and lobster pad thai. The lobster pad thai was great. Huge dish with half a tail. Looking forward to sampling non-noodle dishes.

Reviews.Author: Celina M.
Reviews.Content: Best Thai food in So FLa!

Reviews.Author: M F.
Reviews.Content: The BEST, I just wish they open a location in the Galt Ocean Mile area! We need a great Thai place around here! The only Thai place we around here is Thai To Go... is really bad (not really Thai) and the staff have bad attitude. We have so many residents that love Thai food in this area, owners should consider getting one of the available places we have around here and bring real Thai to Galt Ocean Mile! we are spoiled here, we just walk out of the lobby and we can go dine without using a car! We have two great Greek Restaurants, few nice Italian restaurants, French,  American and a nice jazz club place that has gourmet appetizers...we need a nice Thai restaurant here!Thanks!

Reviews.Author: Cyndee K.
Reviews.Content: Best Thai food ever.  Been going here for 15 years and always great

Reviews.Author: Griff G.
Reviews.Content: Simply as good as it gets down here. And believe it or not, probably the best steak in Fort Lauderdale... yes, better than the major players.....

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: Chicken asparagus = Amazing!  It is seasonal, though.

Reviews.Author: Richard R.
Reviews.Content: Finally a Thai restaurant serving fresh fish and shrimp (as opposed to frozen.)  The whole red snapper with red curry sauce and basil was amazing.  The appetizers of Mee Krob and Yum Woon Sen were excellent, just like in Thailand.  I have reserved 5 stars for Thai restaurants with fresh fish and great flavors and I finally found one.

Reviews.Author: Dave G.
Reviews.Content: For years I lived around the corner from this little gem of a Thai restaurant and ate here so many times.  About 8 years ago I moved to Los Angeles, and I still haven't found Thai food as good as this place.  Being back around my old stomping grounds, it was time to drop in and do a write up.Well some things have changed in my 8 year absence.  The restaurant as well as the menu has expanded and is more high end now, although all their traditional dishes remain.  It was always very nice looking, with some of the prettiest fish tanks you'll ever see in a restaurant, but by expanding into the next door store, it's even nicer.  They are getting ready to expand yet again.  Business must be good, and they deserve it.We started off with my favorite appetizer, Namsod.  I've never found anywhere that does it as well as Thai Spice.  It's ground chicken breast, fresh ginger, roasted peanuts, red onions, cilantro, chopped scallions, lime juice, and chili paste.  The chili paste is fairly mild as the spiciness seems to come from the ginger.  I'm guessing the red onions are "pickled" and really soak up the lime juice flavor.  So many times red onions can be too strong, but not in this dish.  The namsod is served on a small bed of lettuce, and in the past I've ordered just this dish for lunch and been really happy.  I was glad it was just as great as I remember and they haven't changed a thing.  One other appetizer I can brag about is their Curry Puffs.  Ground chicken, sweet potato, onions, are mixed with curry powder and stuffed into a spring roll wrapper.  It's folded into a triangle and deep fried, yum.I value my brother's opinion highly and when he told me I had to try their steaks, I wasn't going to argue.  Steak at a Thai Restaurant, really?  They didn't even have steak, when I used to go there.  But sure enough, not only they have steak, they have Prime Dry Aged steak.  Some great steakhouses don't even have dry aged steak.  So I got the 22 oz Cowboy steak, bone in rib eye.  This was a very thick cut steak, about 3 inches.  Because it was dry aged there wasn't a lot of fat left on the steak, most of that gets lost in the aging process.  They cook it over a very hot open flame and get a nice char to it.  I ordered it medium rare, but it came out more on the rare side.  This was fine for me, but for others might be a problem.  I like rare steak, just as long as it's hot - I'm good.  The seasonings are very very bold.  Almost flavor overload.  They didn't want to tell me exactly what they rubbed all over it, just said it was Thai herbs and ginger garlic soy sauce.  Well, whatever the Thai herbs were, it was one of the most seasoned steaks I've ever had.  But that isn't where it ends..it's served with their Tiger Tear dipping sauce.  I'm guessing it's made from fish sauce, soy sauce, red chili paste, coriander,  lime juice. maybe some brown sugar.  It's very spicy, but I didn't mix it up.  When I poured the remaining sauce on some white rice, I got a lot of the chili at the bottom and it went from very spicy, to "get me some water now!!!" Hot.  Yes it will make a Tiger Cry.  Served on the side was some amazing Bok Choy.  This was also quite spicy as it was sauteed in chili oil.If you don't want to break the bank with one of their $40 steaks, they have plenty of traditional Thai dishes in the $15 range.  Their curries are outstanding.  My wife has always really liked the Pad Woonsen, a thin bean noodle dish sauteed with mixed vegetables, egg, and either chicken, pork, or beef.  Thai Spice has plenty of different seafood dishes on their menu, you'll have a hard choice picking between them.Sometimes when you fall in love with a restaurant, but then move away, you start to think it's better than it really was.  Coming back to Thai Spice after all this time, I can say that, it's just as good as I remember it .  5 stars all the way.

Reviews.Author: Eric D.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice is a decent Thai restaurant that has been slightly Americanized.  This was made apparent when they had zero Thai desserts available.  Not what I expected from what on the outside (décor and main dishes) appeared to be an authentic Thai restaurant.Atmosphere - Swadee Thai...elephants w/ trunks up, Buddha's galore, teak inspired coloring on the wood carvings and lots of fish tanks.  I felt I could have been in Bangkok.Food - I had the Yum Nua (Spicy beef salad) my standard test dish of Thai restaurants (yes, this is now a science).  The dish came w/ sliced grilled beef, red onions, tomato, cucumber, red peppers, cilantro and lime juice...oh and a nice purple flower.  It was good as expected.  Only complaint is that the dish was a little too watery making it difficult to eat.  For my main dish I had the Green Curry Chicken which came w/ chicken (duh!), green curry paste, coconut milk, zucchini, bamboo shoots, pepper, green bean pods and fresh Thai basil.  It was tasty and although I am not a big fan of green pea pods in my dish it was on par with a great and a higher priced Thai restaurant that I went to while in London.  While I love spicey, the waiter was kind enough to steer me away from Thai Hot to a more subtle level of heat.  He even brought out a little dish of assorted spices if I want to turn up the heat.  Yo, momma!!Service - Prompt and lots of refills on my water (the food was spicy).  Waiter was conversational and helpful w/ my selections.    Overall - a nice restaurant, although not a 100% traditional Thai restaurant, it will definitely appeal to your first time Thai diner.

Reviews.Author: Nina C.
Reviews.Content: Anyone who doesn't give this place 5 stars is a complete retard and doesn't deserve to eat period!!! This place was outstanding!!! I had the sea bass with peanut sauce- frickin amazing!! My man had the skirt steak- let me tell ya for a shitty piece of meat (let's be honest) was awesome!! It wasn't tough or gritty just tasted amazing!! The sake was great the waitress was awesome - can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Author: Cyn H.
Reviews.Content: Good food.  Good wait staff.  Just not that extra to a five star

Reviews.Author: Robin E.
Reviews.Content: Upscale Thai. It's good. Really good. It's a date night Thai place. It's not your middle of the week Thai place. Bring the boss. Bring that cute girl in HR. Hell, bring yourself for a sake mojito and Tom Ka Gai.  This is an experience and good food (and I wasn't kidding about that mojito ... it's worth the trip alone). Just know there are equally good Thai places at 1/ 4 of the price ten minutes away, and I only point that out because the sticker shock will get you if you're not prepared.

Reviews.Author: Tony B.
Reviews.Content: I had the Vegetable Curry (medium), 13$ and it was wonderful

Reviews.Author: Manuel R.
Reviews.Content: This is some very very good Thai food. The taste is always consistent. Though a small place the atmosphere is nice and the staff is great. The food is simply delicious. Do you like hot food? You can order it as hot as you can handle it. I recommend "hot" or "thai hot". Prices are very good and this is definitely a place to take you loved one or clients.

Reviews.Author: Tracey Y.
Reviews.Content: I went to this place because of the 4 star rating and the number of reviews.  I had high expectations since the place was not cheap and it supposedly had a 5 star service rating.  That is not what I experienced at all...  First of all this is a Thai restaurant, and the waitress didn't know what Phad Kee Mao is.My entree cost $38, the entire meal close to $70, and the shrimp was not fresh.  It had the aweful fish stink that fresh seafood should not have.  I never ever complain to the restaurant staff at any restaurant, I guess since I'm shy, but I did this time since I expected more from a restaurant that was rated so high and wasn't cheap.  They told me that the chef said the seafood was fine.  It was always fine according to them.  So they didn't give me anything in response, except for that explanation.  I think that's basically telling me that I must be wrong.I have eaten at numerous thai restaurants and this would rank the lowest amongst them.  I am never going back there.

Reviews.Author: Gerald H.
Reviews.Content: Great food

Reviews.Author: Lauren B.
Reviews.Content: Great place! Food is different and delicious. I had coconut soup with chunks of crab which was amazing, and the green curry with beef. The beef is better than other places. The service was fantastic and very attentive.  Will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Author: Helen L.
Reviews.Content: Words I never imagined hearing from my daughter: "Mom- their fried rice actually is better than yours." (and she loves my fried rice!!!) incredibly tasty food, though, I personally tasted more of a Chinese flavor to their cooking than traditional Thai. Nevertheless, highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Ella G.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice is a safe place for taking out business clients. The food is consistent, fresh and very good. It is not your usual Thai place, it is definitely Americanized. It is pricey for lunch, and reservations for six or more should be made in advance. If you want to get in for lunch, come before 12 or after 1pm, this place is packed all the time. Fridays are the worst. Parking is hard, and there are some parking spots in the back of the shopping center. Their service is very good, very attentive. They do have a lunch menu, which is at the very bottom of the right page of the menu. You need to know that since that includes soup or salad. Most people do not know this fact.They do have lots of daily specials, and these are very pricey. A lunch for two can cost up to $60!They have great looking aquariums, which are kept up very well. There is also outside seating for tourists and locals who smoke

Reviews.Author: Dennis C.
Reviews.Content: Great food, and good service.  I agree that it's a little expensive so I'd recommend going for lunch and you'll save a little money.

Reviews.Author: Kevin H.
Reviews.Content: Great restaurant the food is pricey and they are the self proclaim "best Thai in Ft Lauderdale", thats a toss up but the food is very good and the interior and atmosphere are nice.  However because the "ethnic hiring" to keep the theme I understood only "Basil" "prawn" and "duck" when the waitress was reading all the night specials I went for tamarind duck and I WAS NOT disappointed, was very tasty.  On a side note, as a Christmas present to employees(my waitress especially) they ought to think about rosetta stone...ENGLISH

Reviews.Author: Eugene S.
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have eaten at Thai Spice and I have had the best experience and the best food each time I come.  I had the lobster and could not eat it all because it was so large.  Took it home and the next day had another meal out of it.. Can't wait to return.. The best Thai Resturant in Ft Lauderdale.

Reviews.Author: Ryan H.
Reviews.Content: If you like everything on your plate to taste like peanuts, and don't mind paying through the nose for it... factor in A to B seating (Asshole to Belly Button)... well then this place is for YOU... NOT me.

Reviews.Author: Cristina S.
Reviews.Content: This is the first place I've ventured to for lunch in my new "work" neighborhood & it was a great experience. It's a dark little spot in a strip mall with friendly staff & a very extensive menu. I had the Pad Thai with chicken (my safe plate at any thai place, I must admit) & it was delish. It's a huge plate so I definitely took more than half home. The price is just right & I will likely be back soon =)

Reviews.Author: Tom S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and service.

Reviews.Author: Thomas M.
Reviews.Content: I have eaten Thai food across America, Asia, Oceania and I must say this is hands down one of the most authentic and complete Thai restaurants in South Florida. The decor and ambiance is very authentic, clean and friendly. Let me start by saying that each and every waiter knows the specials menu of by heart and it's as big as the whole menu!!! I always enjoy testing them on how the food is prepared and what ingredients are used as they present each dish with such pride and precision. I love it. The food is always fresh and very authentic, be careful the spice scale is Thai spice. So don't be a hero and go Thai hot on your first day unless you're a pro and subscribe to man vs. food spicy food challenges. Personal Favorites; Crispy Calamari (no batter, but crispy), Pad Kee Mao, Pad Thai, snapper in coconut and cilantro seasoning, don't remember the actual name. All the curries are very good and extra creamy. Two Thai Spring rolls are not to be missed. Once I ordered two portions of the Crispy Calamari appetizer for my entree, yes its that good, yes I'm insane!Can't say if the whole staff is Thai or Filipino, but they do such a great job. Always busy lunch and dinner. When i think of Thai Spice I get that happy feeling you get when IKEA opened a store in South Florida. You know it's going to be good, it will be unique, you will always go there, it will never get boring and always make you wonder how do they make such simple things so good. Now where is that napkin as i drooled on the keyboard LOL

Reviews.Author: Marilyn O.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite restaurant! The food is consistently good and fresh. I usually go for lunch and order from the lunch specials which are reasonable priced. It is expensive for dinner but the Thai food is the best I have ever had. If you like Thai food, this will become your new favorite place.

Reviews.Author: Michael M.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. The food is amazing! Great service as well and a very nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Mark H.
Reviews.Content: This must surely be the best Thai restaurant in Florida.  The food is absolutely wonderful.  I like the Tom Yum 'Thai Hot'.  Dine-in, take-out or delivery, either way you cannot go wrong.  Brian, the delivery man (who is very conscientious), apologized for the food being late even though it wasn't.  He informed me that If I want to order for lunch delivery that I need to do it extra early because they get slammed early on with orders from office buildings.  I am not surprised at all ... the food is just that good.  I appreciate the tip Brian, you rock!

Reviews.Author: Joel M.
Reviews.Content: Food is great here. The chicken with peanut sauce is amazing! The restaurant does get packed at times and the parking lot gets full. Last time I was there it was 1 to 1 1/2 hour wait. Luckily I was taking my food to go:)

Reviews.Author: Sima P.
Reviews.Content: First time at this restaurant, the food is great, but the service is even better. Min was our server for happy hour and she was amazing!!! I've been to many restaurants and this one is definitely one of the best!!! Would definitely return to this restaurant and recommend.

Reviews.Author: Foodie W.
Reviews.Content: Wow!  When you ask for medium, be prepared!  Awesome nam sod full of flavor. Flights of 3 saki for $13, great way to try something new, and flights are served in sexy stacked rack.  Jake our server was helpful and fast. Place was packed on a wed night.

Reviews.Author: K H.
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely amazing! Exquisite!!! The owner understands premier customer service and has trained the employees to continue the exceptional service culture! I have had no better food w/ awesome service combined anywhere else (from any type of cuisine). It is a must visit! U will be a loyal customer for life!

Reviews.Author: Trina R.
Reviews.Content: I have been there for lunch a couple times and it was pretty good.  My great experience was when I went for dinner.  The waitress was exceptional and made sure to tell us all the specials.  I had the calamari in a chili sauce as anappetizer which was delicious and the scallops and shrimp in a green coconut curry sauce.  It was an excellent meal! I was very happy when I left.

Reviews.Author: Nic E.
Reviews.Content: My first time to thai spice was on Monday night. I was a little hesitant to go there but after years of asking I joined my husband for dinner. I was pleasantly surprised by the inside of the restaurant, much nicer than it looks like from the street. We sat at the bar where is was happy hour on food and appetizers, the menu can be pricey but the portions were plenty to share.

Reviews.Author: Jenny N.
Reviews.Content: Food is excellent! Staff is courteous. However don't order for delivery~~~ took over 1 1/2 hrs to deliver my food & I live only 5 mins away!

Reviews.Author: B E.
Reviews.Content: Everyone raves about this place and it was absolutely packed on the Saturday night we went. We opted for outside seating instead of waiting 30+ minutes inside. The service was initially very good, but was a bit slow at the end when our waitress was a little in the weeds. The ginger salad had ample freshly pureed ginger/carrot dressing, the crispy duck was fantastic, and the panang curry was also very good. Overall, I have no complaints - it has definitely earn its reputation. However, for the price, I'll stay with Sake Thai/Sushi in Hollywood, where the service is always great and the food is just as good, but nearly half the price.

Reviews.Author: Wes D.
Reviews.Content: This place is really cool, I love the vibe you get when you dine there. The staff was great the food was super. I just wanted to show my appreciation for a real top notch restaurant!

Reviews.Author: Wes I.
Reviews.Content: The food and the service was great! My family and I ate outside because we did not have a reservation but it was a good first time experience.

Reviews.Author: Xyz A.
Reviews.Content: Happy hour in the bar is brilliant; half price appetizers, try the Thai Fresh Rolls, Coco Shrimp and Chicken Wing, very good!

Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: Better than average S FL Thai resteraunt, but pricier, too. Is it worth the extra dinero?  Not really.

Reviews.Author: Julia T. M.
Reviews.Content: The place is on a pricey side but it's very good food. I would particularly recommend crispy basil squid, which is exactly what is says: crispy and basil. Curries are also very delicious.

Reviews.Author: D S.
Reviews.Content: Food is excellent.  Unfortunately not all of it. We order a curry, a couple of soups and a seafood salad. The shrimps on on the seafood salad where saggy an almost raw. Very expensive considering the quality.

Reviews.Author: Rose V.
Reviews.Content: Very good green curry, although mine was supposed to come with tofu and only ended up coming with vegetables. My friends all had the whole fish, pretty spectacular looking.

Reviews.Author: Penny K.
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, beautiful ambiance, cool fish tanks and the food is superb.

Reviews.Author: Keat G.
Reviews.Content: Great service, but a little pricey for Thai food.I had the soft shell crab appetizer, which was OK, not great.  Also ordered the seafood curry, but made the mistake of asking for it to be made "spicy."  It was way too spicy -- I advise "mild" to anyone going there.Also, the portions of rice were way too small.  A meal with an appetizer, an entree and ice tea will run to over $30 after tips.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: Everytime I come to Lauderdale, I make a Point to come here!  Their curry dishes are delish!!

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline S.
Reviews.Content: Best Thai in town

Reviews.Author: Amit D.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best Thai food I have ever eaten.  Panang Chicken = Amazing!Samrod Chicken (substituted Chicken for Pork) = AmazingPad Thai = AmazingEven the Poorman's fried rice was excellent.

Reviews.Author: Lucas J.
Reviews.Content: Ok, the place is beautiful inside. The food is well presented. The service is efficient and pretty professional. Language can be a problem. The list of specials can be quite long but we could barely understand a word our server said. This was our second time there because we signed up online and received a bogo in the mail. A couple of days later we had some time to kill before a concert at the hard rock and went to Emerald Thai on State Road 84. Emerald Thai has much better food, much larger portions. We've been there numerous times and it is always consistently great.

Reviews.Author: Donna K.
Reviews.Content: Went there because of the yelp reviews! It was excellent-the outdoor seating was along the front of the building along the sidewalk but at least it's outdoors. We had the panang curry pork and bangkok chicken along with chicken satay appetizer. Excellent! Next time we are in town we will be back!

Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: Great food

Reviews.Author: K B.
Reviews.Content: Tried Thai Spice for the first time tonight. Got delivery. It was GREAT!!! I ordered Pad Thai and asked them to recommend their best appetizer under $10. The person on the phone said her favorite was the curry puffs and I am so glad she recommended them.The pad thai was delicious and the curry puffs were great. They came with 2 sauces which were soooo good, also .Also, when I ordered delivery it was right during their dinner rush. They said to expect it to arrive in 45 minutes to 1 hour, which was fine with me. It arrived however, in about 30 minutes. Pretty darn fast.Can't wait to try some of their other dishes and take my husband in to eat in the restaurant! Yum yum yum.

Reviews.Author: Jorge S.
Reviews.Content: Hard to find good Asian food down here in South Florida, let alone a good Thai restaurant that is not OVER PRICED! Thai Spice fits the bill as a moderately priced yet quality Thai dishes with a spectaculer green curry sauce. Service was excellent and the overall atmosphere was very comfortable without becoming stuffy. I think from now on this is where I will go for Thai food.

Reviews.Author: Lora T.
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the tuna app and the shrimp app. We also ordered the shrimp fired rice, volcano shrimp, and the pad thai. Liked the fried rice the best. Felt the appetizers were better than the meal but overall enjoyed everything.

Reviews.Author: Vasilie C.
Reviews.Content: I ordered red curry with scallops and it was delicious. The salad had the best peanut sauce I've ever had and the spring rolls were ok. My date had Thai noodles with tofu and the tofu was perfect with a crispy outside and delicious inside. The noodles were a bit rubbery, but the flavor was good. My only gripe with the place was our server, who left us without a drink refill through our appetizer, salad, and halfway through entree. Luckily the manager came by and asked how everything was going. I told him I appreciated him coming over and he said he would fix the situation. At first he didn't quite understand what I was saying I guess. I told him that I ordered spicy food and it was a problem to not have water refilled at all. I then told him I had to go so far as to ask the bus boy for a refill and he had taken care of it. The manager responded with: do you want more spices on the side? Despite the communication problem, they did recover from the slip up, so I would come back but I won't be sat at that server's table again.

Reviews.Author: Eli S.
Reviews.Content: My review begins with me trying to find the perfect (pad) Thai. ( new suggestions appreciated ) . I moved into the area less than three weeks ago, and last night was my second attempt after scanning Internet reviews and delivery menus of local Thai restaurants.  Iv had Thai from a few other places in Florida since I moved here from NYC a few months ago and sadly I have to say it goes the same for the pizza,  I just haven't found one that iv truly been satisfied with so far. hoping to prove my analysis wrong, and still determined for pad Thai I ordered a delivery order from Thai spice.  An order of pad Thai chicken (15) 2 coconut milk soups ( 4.5 x 2 ) and a pint of brown rice ( unknown ) came to $32.50 , even for being regularly comfortable with NYC prices I thought that was a lil high but at the time I didn't really care, until .. After eating the first bite of chicken, and then ripping all of the pieces apart, it was clear to me that the meat was not fully cooked, I called back and there was no answer , it said open till 10 it was 10:01.  Today I had called , explained to them my disappointment with my order and they resent a new order of chicken pad Thai that I asked to be cooked well done this time.  The order they sent back was in the same size container though only half way full, and again the chicken was rubbery on the inside and not grainy like it should look fully cooked. So I paid 15 for basically an order that I did not get to eat. My conclusion on Thai spice is completely over priced for service that they are inaccurate to provide. I'd ADVISE checking your meat thoroughly most disease are ingested into the bodily system by dead cells hosting parasites that feed and harness themselves in the corpesd carcases  of dead animals. So I'd give this restaurant a WARNING advisory rather than just a review.

Reviews.Author: Monika K.
Reviews.Content: service was not so great, decor was pleasant and ambiance was nice, server didn't offer us the specials but did to the table next to us, we split the yum woonsen which was just decent, tom yum gai was ok but nothing great, bf ordered the porterhouse which he liked but he better have at $40, i had chicken panang curry, even though i asked for it hot, i did not taste any spice whatsoever, didn't get a friendly welcoming vibe there, the server seemed annoyed when we didn't want to order dessert. one time is  enough for this place.

Reviews.Author: Dean C.
Reviews.Content: I am giving Thai Spice five stars based on delivery of food to my nearby hotel room.  I have eaten Thai food in all kinds of places - converted Denny's restaurants, minimalist college-town storefronts, elegantly appointed "important date" restaurants - even from an Italian-Thai restaurant in Chicago called Luigi's!  The food from Thai Spice was insanely good.  I used to dine at a wonderful little restaurant in Chicago (Bangkok House) that served delicious spring rolls, and I've been hunting for any other place that served them that way - not the deep-fried mess that you get in so many places, but the doughy wrap, the crisp, fresh vegetables, the hint of shrimp, along with the most delectable sauces to compliment them.  Just the "Fresh Roll" was enough to justify five stars for me!  I also ordered the Tom Yung Goong, which did not disappoint in any way.  The delicious broth, mushrooms and vegetables cradled three delicious shrimp.  Wonderful!  And finally, for an entree I chose the Green Curry Chicken, one of my favorites that I recently re-discovered.  The coconut milk-based sauce was heavenly.  Even though I ordered medium spicy it was very digestible even for a sensitive constitution.  I am in Ft. Lauderdale without a car so the fact that Thai Spice delivers was a real bonus.  The food was promised in 45 minutes - it came in 30.  How wonderful!  If you have the chance to eat this food - do it - restaurant visit or no!

Reviews.Author: Derya D.
Reviews.Content: Best thai food ever! Grilled calamari and sea food red curry were amazing!!!

Reviews.Author: frank w.
Reviews.Content: Words cannot express how good the food is here. had whole deep fried snapper,grilled calamari ,stuffed chicken wing, grouper and duck. Each dish was flawless and the best I've ever had. Was in Bangkok two months ago and had nothing even close to the quality here.

Reviews.Author: Teresa S.
Reviews.Content: Thai Spice has the best thai food in South Florida period. I've been eating here for a few years now and other thai restaurants just don't compare. Anyone who rates this restaurant lower than 4 starts is insane. I've eaten many dishes on the menu and it's fantastic!!

Reviews.Author: J S.
Reviews.Content: Best Thai restaurant in all of South FL!
